My guy got the Surf & Turf (Filet mignon & lobster) which came w/ garlic mashed potatoes & asparagus (he changed it for one of their other sides and they upcharge $4 for the change). My steak was good but my spinach was uneatable..no exaggeration, they were THE SALTIEST thing I've eaten my entire life..I think they might have accidently dumped salt in them. I told our waitress and got brussel sprouts instead, they were too charred and dripping w grease. His food was fine, steak was good and lobster was so so, potatoes were good. I must admit the broccoli he substituted was DELICIOUS!! I would recommend the broccoli here but that's really about it.

All in all:
Service - our waitress was polite and nice, she was great!

Food - pretty terrible, they messed up very simple stuff

Price - in comparison to the atmosphere and the food, definitely not worth it! You can get a better meal at another steak house that has a much better ambience and much livelier. Honestly though, im a foodie and if the food is great I'll go anywhere and this just wasn't. 

Atmosphere - small, not very lively. Nothing interesting.

I really wanted to absolutely love this place but I just didn't love it as much as I wanted to. The decor is gorgeous and the dining room is much smaller than I expected but really nice. Our server was friendly and helpful. I had the linguine and some sweet potato tots. The tots were great and not too sweet. The pasta was a little too spicy and soupy for my taste (the chili flakes were dispersing in the broth). My friend and I shared the cookie for dessert. It was nice and hot and cake with ice cream; delicious. All in all, dinner was nice, liked everything but my entree. Nice place for a date night or private event.

Drink menu - so many choices, so much fun.  I tend to try something new, then order a Moscow Mule, partly because it comes in a cute little tin mug.

Food - yummy flatbreads...and the Pork & Fig is sooo good!

We had a great dinner. Food was delicious and service was a joy.

Take advantage of their happy hour (until 8 pm) and you get discounts on beer and cocktails as well as some of the meals on the menu.

I would recommend it to friends any time.

Herbs & Rye is hands down mine & my boyfriends favorite restaurant in all of Vegas.  The steaks are off the charts... oh & the brussel sprouts....yum yum...  But what we love the most is how we are always treated.  Everyone greets us with big smiles, hugs & calls us by name.  We always sit in the bar area because we like the atmosphere in there.  Christian, Ronnie, Emily are the bomb!!!  Thanks for making my birthday awesome.

To be honest for the price the food is okay. I love he drinks. Great Dibalo but still pricey. I had a salmon which was great though. Ambiance is quiet for a Wednesday. I guess their happy hour is okay. But not a buzzing vibe. Would rather spend my money on a fancier restaurant on the strip then be here.

This will be on my list of places I need to eat at every time I'm in Vegas.  Upon arriving we had some issues, we actually didn't get in until an hour after our reservation time.  Having a hangry group of 11, we started to get a bit fussy.  They sent shots on the house outside where we were waiting as well as some bread baskets which made us much happier and made the trips inside one by one to complain go away.  Once seated, we had a wonderful waitress [really wish I got her name!].  I don't believe we're the easiest group to deal with honestly and she kept a smile on her face the entire time!  Appetizers we got some shrimp cocktail which was delicious, also an order of wings that came out cold but we were so hungry we didn't seem to care.  Everyone at the table got steak and had good things to say about it other than a few complaints about the way their meats were cooked.  I personally am not much of a steak person but I tried my fiance's and it was delicious!  I got the chicken breast on angel hair pasta and it was fantastic!  Their extensive cocktail list was pretty awesome too!  I tried a few from the table and they were all yummy.  I'll definitely be back.

Great place for just drinks or a good dinner.  Come between 5-8 for happy hour and get half price steaks. The broccoli and cheese side is awesome.  Ronnie the server was great.  My wife's new favorite place for drinks.

I really enjoyed the food - and the *amazing* cocktails.  What a classic list!  Not trendy, Classic.  Our server in the bar area tables was not the best as far as guest empathy and showing concern, and the drinks took *forever* to arrive, but maybe it was an off night for her when we went.  The bartender was busy talking to the people sitting at the bar and possibly didn't see the drink ticket?  Our server was nice enough, just not super nice, nor super attentive.

Of the things we tried for dinner, the little neck clams were delicious.  My advice is skip the very good steak - get the Pork and Figs instead!!  OUTSTANDING.  That's what will have me coming back soon.

My boyfriend and I came in Tuesday night for dinner. It was our second time trying this place out. Everything was so delicious, happy hour was great. Service was friendly and efficient. This is a hidden gem and an awesome place for date night dinner. We will definitely be back and recommend it to all of our friends.
This is one of the more popular local gems for Vegas locals. They have an AMAZING happy hour discount, and their food and classic and specialty cocktails are always on point. love love love.

UPDATE! I am just not ok with knowing I have a 3 star review for this place. The first time I went I had a great experience and my bf had a horrible one (read previous review) However, I talked him into going back and since we've returned 3 more times! We always go for happy hour between midnight and 3am. After trying 3 different steaks my favorite is the Bone in Kansas City cooked medium well add herbs and rye rub. I've had the blue cheese crust and the mushrooms and onions toppers. Both are yummy but they don't top the rub. Another highlight is the chicken wings. They are so different from any wings I have ever tried. I also had a chopped salad that was a meal in itself. I don't know what it is but every time I go here, I eat every single bite of everything. Appetizer, salads, sides, desserts (get the donuts) EVERYTHING! 
The mixology is one of a kind. Whether you choose one of the old school vivations, or a simple cran & vodka- its made special every time. They truly aim to please. So ignore the fact that this place looks like a hole in the wall bar, because once you walk thru those doors you are in a whole new time. A classy, enjoyable one.

After seeing this place in magazine after magazine and having friends tell me to give the cocktails a try, we finally went on a double dinner date last night on Valentine's Day! 
The vibe is speak easy swanky 20'sans 30's theme with dim lights, cool hip music and a bar to die for. The drinks definitely have bigger placement on the menu however the food is simple and amazing. 

We started off with a Mary Pinkerton (drink) which was fruity and frothy. It opened up my taste buds for an amazing flat bread covered with sausage. The flat bread was great with the perfect amount of seasoning. I had the Kansas City bone in for dinner with the truffle Mac and cheese. My steak was accompanied by the house rub which was almost like an ancho chili paste spice rub. It was delightful and my steak was cooked to perfection. The Mac and cheese was good but lacked some seasoning. My dinner party ordered the strip steak and asparagus, jalapeño creamed corn and sweet potato Tots, all of which were enjoyable. 

Dessert was THE BEST PART! 
The donuts were absurdly perfect! Covered in sugar with a soft chewy dough! I of course covered mine in chocolate ganache! Yum!!


Creme brûlée was creamy and rich! 
The warm cookie was great for sharing with three scoops of rich vanilla ice cream! You couldn't beat it! 



We will definitely go back.
It's a great off the strip joint to being visitors who want a old school taste of Vegas!

I have been meaning to try Herbs and Rye for the LONGES time.  I can't believe it's taken me over 2 years living in Vegas to get out to this amazing restaurant.  Before I even talk about how incredible the food and drinks were, let's talk about the ridiculously amazing happy hour!! 50% off steaks from 5-8pm??? WHAT?!  AMAZING. (PS If you get there at 7:50, like we did, they'll give you til a few min after 8pm to get the order in. So nice!)

Here's what we drank....basically everything.  I wish I remembered the specific drinks - every single thing we ordered was not only inventive, but very well balanced (which is the #1 thing I look for in a cocktail).  Their cocktail menu takes you on a delicious tour through the many eras of booze.

We ordered the beef tartare: it was excellent!  I'm super picky about beef tartare, and this one was delicious and had a great presentation as well.  We also ordered the filet and some asparagus.  Of which, we ate every last bite.  I will definitely be back - happy hour or otherwise.

My brothers friend lives in vegas and recommended this place when i asked him where to go for a good dinner- more like great dinner! I made reservations during happy hour ( half off the starred menu items) we all got the new york strip steak and it came with one side ( half off!) ... OMG that truffle mac and cheese tho! Garlic mashed potatoes, jalapeno creamed corn and brussel sprouts were all bomb! I asked for a1 sauce and didnt even need to use it. We will definitely be back- nice ambience and prohibition feel to it... Next time ill try the drinks since this time we didnt wanna get wastey pants and actually enjoy our dinner since we were on vacation. Great food, great price ( $90 for 3 of us) , great service- viva herbs & rye!

Herbs and Rye has become my new favorite go-to spot for cocktails.  The wait staff are phenomenal, and I love the dark speakeasy vibe (red velvet wallpaper, black booths, and swanky chandeliers).  I've rarely seen it crowded, which actually kind of worries me because I wonder how it stays in business!

They have some steakhouse style food, but what I go for are the fantastic creative (old school style) drinks and service.  The "classic cocktails" are amazing, and the service is personal and helpful.  There are a few drinks that dabble with absinthe, so if you're a fan of the licoricey liquor, here's a place to try it.  My favorite drink is the Aviator - which from my memory is a combo of gin, lime, and a violet infused liquor - oh my!  They also serve classics like "Moscow Mule" and will likely make anything you request.

The happy hour deal is fantastic, with some of the steaks (half price).  My friend labelled it as one of the best steaks he's ever had.  I have tried a few of the flatbread pizzas, which are a fair deal at $10 a piece.  We tried the linguine and clams, which was good but not the best I've ever had.

For a cool off-strip vibe with great cocktails and an atmosphere where you can chat with your friends (i.e. not blasting boom-boom music), or sit at the bar on your own, check this place out!
I have been to this place a couple of times. Go for the happy hour and order the steak. The mixed drinks are great, and the menu explains the history behind each drink.  Neat place

Okay, this is not the first time I've been here nor will it be my last. herbs and Rye is the one place I recommend to anyone new to town or friends wanting a good steak.  Best steak, best sides, AMAZING DONUTS!!!!!!   You have to have the donuts for dessert.  SAVE ROOM, I PROMISE YOU'LL THANK ME!!!!

first time coming in here for happy hour. i tried their prohibition cocktail blood and sand its a mix of scotch, heering, dry vermouth, lemon and OJ. Its absolutely delicious i had to have another round for $9 its absolutely worth it! We took a few shots of chocolate cake, it's ok for $9 a shot. i dont think it'll be ordering it again. Our bartender Bryan was ok. It was an experience because of the cocktails and the company that i was with. i wish their service was as great as their drinks.

I've been here several times, and my experience has been mixed.  The atmosphere is great, the service dependable, and the drinks are really good.  However, the food is very hit or miss.  I've had times where the steak is delicious and other times where its made me throw up, same thing with the mac and cheese.  

Their drink menu is a big plus, but while they are priced around standard 8-9 dollars per cocktail, they are on the smaller side.  

Wish I could like this, but probably won't be back here for awhile considering I threw up my last few meals at H&R.

Honestly were to start.. The only reason for the 1 star, is because the food is amazing. 
I have given this pace SO many chances and it fails every time. The service here is HORRENDOUS! It takes about 30 minutes to receive a cocktail and you should probably look at the menu before you go and order as soon as the waiter takes your drink order because you won't see them for about another 25 minutes. The one instance that really irritated me was my boyfriend and I arrived around 5pm for happy hour, and the place was empty. We were the first guests to sit in the bar area. The server came right over, took our drink order and we didnt see him again until 30 minutes later! More tables started to arrive and he went to take care of each of them instead of returning to us to deliver our drinks or take our order. We sat and watched the server take 3 orders from other tables before even coming back to us. At this point we had already been at the restaurant for about 45 minutes with no drink and no order placed. Now being in the service industry myself, I understand it gets busy and you get behind but to at least acknowledge a table that has been waiting for a long time is all I ask for. The server finally came over to take our order and we politely reminded him we still had not received the tea and coke we ordered. Was not even apologetic or anything, just took our order and returned with the drinks. The food came out in a timely manner and was delicious as always. He checked on us maybe one time and it took us another 25 minutes after we were done eating to get the check and pay. It was an ordeal just to enjoy a dinner with my boyfriend.
     I seriously have given this place three other chances since then to change my mind and it has failed each time. The service gets worse every single time I went and its like the servers don't even care. The happy hour is great and the food is to die for, but I hate being neglected as a paying and tipping customer. Ive come at all different times, not just during happy hour and its still awful. It saddens me to even write this because this is the only place in Vegas that knows how to cook a steak properly.

Half-price steaks during happy-hour ... that should be "'nuff said".
However, the ambience is cool, it's away from the Strip and easy to get to with plenty of parking. 
Despite the fact there was a big party going on their private room, service was really great.
The steaks were good as well as the sides (big enough to share), the fresh made donut dessert melts in your mouth.
Wine list has a nice selection, creative cocktails, good food, great service, altogether a great experience.

Herbs & Rye tonight for late night happy hour! Having a treat myself night now that I'm feeling better :) this meal was Fantastic!!! & I eat well all the time. Ordered the 9oz Filet Mignon with a side of truffle mac & cheese. Wow, just wow! Been awhile since since I had a steak so good I didn't need steak sauce (I got a side anyways). These steaks for half off are a steal. The truffle Mac & cheese was delicious. A light truffle taste, but the Mac is very cheesy with a good consistency. Didn't take any flash pictures to capture the low light ambiance in the joint. Definitely one of the best happy hours in town.

This place is actually better than it looks from the outside. This restaurant bar is different from any other restaurant in Las Vegas. The menu times are very creative and the staff is very nice and professional. The drinks are different and awesome. The stake is hands down the best stake I've had in town. Leave some room for dessert and have donuts with white chocolate and caramel! Highly recommend this for a group of friends or simply a date!!!

Finally made it to H&E!

Since we just had an amazing dinner, I came here completely full...so no half price steaks for me!

We ordered a handful of beers and some cocktails.....they weren't cheap, but not obnoxiously overpriced either.  

Just being this kind of hole in the wall place, I would have thought the drinks be a little cheaper...at least during happy hour anyways.  I don't know if I would have ever stopped in here if it wasn't for Yelp.

The environment is clean and comfortable though, and the service was good.  It would be a good place to come for drinks, and maybe for the steaks I keep hearing about :)

I've been here many times and the drinks are excellent! They do not skimp on the alcohol either. The food is delicious and they have steaks on happy hour. The staff is always friendly and attentive. Nice 1920's ambiance. I will keep coming back!

A rally great happy hour with most of the steaks being 50% off.  I enjoyed a solid flat iron for $14.99, not the best steak I've ever had, but definitely memorable enough to give a repeat visit.

I also ordered the donuts (based on so many comments) and they were so soft, warm and delicious and having the white chocolate and caramel dipping sauce was the perfect finish to the meal!

I love the vibe here, and the food, and the drinks. 

The tartar was hands down delicious. Meatballs were a hit as well. Pork and figs is my new favorite dish. Ordered some truffle mac and cheese and that was great as well. Ordered all of the desserts except for the creme brûlée  and they were all delicious. My favorites were the cookie and the donuts. I didn't want to share my dessert haha. 
I was drinking Pimm's Cup and it was perfect and super refreshing. 

Happy hour it gets a little packed in here, so it's best to make a reservation. Every time I try to come here without calling ahead I regret it. 

Be sure to try this place out, happy hour or not, you're going to be pleased!

Mixed Review for Service and Food. Parking is horrid, parked 2 blocks away, not located in the best area. Huge waiting line out front, lucky we had reservations. My husband and I went for a nice evening out during their Happy Hour from 5-8 PM, when steaks are half price. Reservation requested "quiet table." Seated in the corner, so far, so good, 2 minutes later they seat a group of 10 guys on a boys night out/business dinner right next to us. I asked to be moved but they had nothing that was any better. The place is very loud and you can barely hear yourself think. Server was cordial, but busboy delivered warm bread to every other table around us, including the one next to us before us and by the time we got our bread, the meal was already delivered. We both ordered the ribeye and mine was to have sauteed mushrooms and onions topper. My husband's steak was average and mine was so marbled that there was a glaze of fat on my plate that shined in the dim lighting. Mushroom and onion topper was primarily onions. Apparently, they do not believe in seasoning the steak as it was bland. The server did not offer to send it back for another one, just brought me the salt and pepper shaker, no fresh cracked available. Only saving grace was the Truffle Mac and Cheese which was delicious, but I have no idea why "truffle" was in the name as I could not detect anything truffle related. Cocktail was good. Bar was packed with younger crowd. Place only has 1 bathroom for both sexes and had a very long line. Price was good but I had the impression from the server that they were doing us a favor by allowing us to purchase a $54.00 steak for $27. Dinner out was still $100 and I left there unimpressed.
First time going and everything was awesome!! Great cocktails great food and awesome service!! We'll definitely be going back and I recommend it to everyone!

This place has been on my list for a long time. We got super lucky scoring a same-day reservation for 6 people on a Saturday night. Unfortunately, we were a party of 10, so had to pull a sleazy move that I'm not proud of to cut a few folks out. This place is a short drive off the strip, but traffic around 5pm is hell in Vegas. The hostess was understanding (thank you!) and we were seated as soon as we arrived. 

As other yelp-ers have told you, the happy hour deal on steaks is smoking and available on Saturdays, too. I don't eat much meat and wouldn't pay full price for the NY strip I ordered, but for $21 definitely can't complain. It comes with one side- I chose the spinach which was good, but again, glad I didn't have to pay $8 for the small dish. B ordered the steak fries which were perfect- hot, not greasy, crisp on the outside and soft inside. The large Caesar salad with an unmemorable dressing had plenty of lettuce, but was missing the promised anchovies. 

But let's be honest, the real reason to come here is the cocktails. The menu is all classics. I ordered the Ford cocktail (wanted to try something new) and a last word (because that's what I had been craving. Both well-balanced and lovely. Our server, Jeremy, was great. He shared some of the history of the place and highlights of their most recent accolades. He was patient answering questions about the drink list and didn't rush to clear us out even though I'm sure the tables are in high-demand on a Friday night during HH. 

I would definitely return, though will stick to drinks and sit in the bar where you get to see the bartenders in action.
I absolutely LOVE this place. I have been here many times and have never had a bad meal or been disappointed - my steak always melts in my mouth! Can't wait to go again!

Ambience = bad lighting, hhahha.. so true. But, don't let the dark place fool your taste palate. We didn't really have any expectation and it exceeded ours. Their happy hour is one of the best in LV. if you want a pretty good and decent steak on the lower price range, this is the place. 

Go for their drinks and steaks and you are all set.  We were glad we made a reservation as they had to turn down some people who didn't have reservation due to fully book restaurant, but maybe because we were there during a holiday weekend.

I really enjoyed this place.  The decor was amazing!  Reminded me of an old school vegas type of spot where you might find some gangsters having dinner and drinks in the back corner. Even though the place was packed I was able to snag two seats at the bar pretty quickly. The drinks were great.  I had a Moscow Mule and some other specialty drink that I don't quite remember the name of.  For dinner we had salads which were both delicious. The bread was really good too. Happy hour specials were good but the food is a little on the high end so prepare to spend about $30 on a steak even if it's half off during happy hour.  The portion sizes are large but I'd like to see some smaller portions at more reasonable prices. The staff was entertaining and accomodating. The only reason i gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the entree costs. If you're looking for a dark,  loud,  trendy spot with lots of action this is it.  If you want something quaint and quiet go elsewhere.
Server named Deborah was awful. Ruined our meal with her poor service. Food was decent, drinks were pretty good. But will not return.

Off the beaten path but well worth the trip. When you walk into this place you immediately feel like you're taken back in time.  The wait staff is top notch. I can't stress point enough. From the moment the manager greets you to when you pay the bill and walk out they are there when you need them and out of sight when you don't.    

Dinner consisted of the following: 

Drinks - 2 Moscow Mules, 1 glass of red to accompaniment my Ribeye.

Starters - Clams and tuna tartare 

Dinner - Ribeye with truffle mac and cheese.

Herbs and Rye seems to be the last bastion of the creative mixology in Las Vegas.  At times, it almost seems like a school for young up-and-coming cocktail artists, marshaled by the seasoned head bartender.

The cocktail menu is refreshing in its focus on classic and prohibition era cocktails, but if you are in the mood for something more modern or unique, the bartender will mix you up something fancy and catering to your specific tastes.

The atmosphere is very calm and cozy, a great place to relax after dinner or to recover from a taxing experience in a more 'energetic' bar.  The music I can't quite remember, but I'd like to say it was Jazz.  All I do remember is that it was great background music for a conversation.

I hope the word spreads more for this spot, they deserve a place in the Las Vegas local's scene.

Definitely an awesome place to get a great steak at a fair price. The Filet Mignon just melts in your mouth. The drinks are awesome as well go see Mark the bartender, he provides great recommendations and is knowledgeable about the drinks.

This review is for 4.5 stars.

I have to preface this review and rate the bar/drinks separately than the food.  The bartenders were exceptional and the food was very good for the half off, Happy Hour price, but not wroth the actual price.  The bar was a 5 star no doubt, while the food was 4 stars.

I ordered 3 separate drinks while dining at Herbs & Rye.  Each time I asked for a certain type of alcohol and they surprised me with a delicious concoction.  The menu is extensive by itself, but I always love getting unique, unknown drinks from great bartenders when possible.  Trust me, the drinks are top notch, but on par with strip prices ($12).

The food was very solid as well.  I had the rib eye and a side of brussel sprouts.  Since it was Happy Hour the steak was half off, but I don't think it was worth the full asking price of $40+.  If it wasn't for the great half off prices for my steak, I think I would have rated the meal portion of my visit lower.

Overall I enjoyed my dinner very much.  For a cocktail, this is the place to go.  The bqrtenders are friendly, knowledgable, and on top of their mix drink game.  The food was solid at Happy Hour prices (5-8pm), but a bit high for a regular night out on the town compared to similar Vegas strip steak restaurants.  Herbs & Rye is close enough to the strip to warrant a trip.  I definitely recommend a visit.

Oooh myyyy!!! This place was incredible! Prohibition era...it was such am amazing experience. I absolutely loved everything a out it. The service was excellent. The options of drinks was amazing and so different. They are all very unique not something you can just get anywhere. They have  happy hour where some of the things on the menu were half off including the 18 ounce ribeye which was phenomenal!!  Sides are ala carte. We had the mushrooms, truffle Mac n cheese,garlic spinach, garlic potatoes, broccoli and cheese, 3 different deserts and several appetizers. Everything was to die for!! You will not be disappointed!!!

The food was very pricy and if your ready to spend that much go!
The service was good, he was that typical waiter, doesn't want to come to the table to much. 

I order the Pork and fig, it was super delicious, but I, as a cook myself, have never cooked a pork as rare as I had it. I couldn't really tell because the lighting was really dark, but the next I'm completely sick!!! I have never had to actually order the TEMP of pork before! If someone does not want it well done they say so! But the only reason I'm suffering right now is because I gave them the benefit of the doubt and believed in the cooks!

IF YOU ORDER THE PORK MAKE SURE YOU TELL THEM A TEMP TO!! because apparently it's a new thing to cook them medium RARE!! 

My boyfriend got the strip steak which he order rare and was perfectly cooked!
My girl friend got the salmon. I tried as well it was delicious.
They both loved the mash potatoes!

For dessert, they had home-made doughnuts with two different sauces, a white coconut and a delicious buttery caramel. Me and my girl friend over stuffed our faces with dessert!

"I could of skipped dinner and just had that dessert!" - we all said.


The alcohol selection was fantastic! I've tried scotch for the first time. I don't prefer it, but it was so cool, the one mix drink they have with scotch, they hold an orange peel over the alcohol and light the top on fire. SUPER cool.

The atmosphere was beautiful, the lighting kept changing in the middle of our dinner, which was weird. 

My girl friend that took me loves this place for the scotch, it's not my scene, but for someone that likes really good aged alcohol will love this place.

Great Happy Hour !! but the wait for our food was long, also it was drafty and cold. Besides that the food was good when it came out. Great garlicky caesar salad and NY was cooked perfect (medium). We also ordered the flatbread, which had a crispy crust and a good amount of cheese. Also their  sourdough bread was amazing, since it just came out of the oven.

I would have given them 3 stars because service was very good and atmosphere was nice. Meatballs were great. Fig and pork dinner was good and pasta was good. Drinks tasted like kool-aid. 

But I dropped it to one star because the seafood dish was so bad. The kitchen sink seafood medley smelled and tasted bad .... And the person who ate it got food poisoning.

Super fun place for drinks.  If this review was based on cocktails alone it would be a higher rating.  That being said,  the food is good but not amazing.  It is a little steep for the food you actually get. 

The ambience on the other hand is lovely. Very dark and intimate, giving it a very 20's speak easy feel.  The bartenders strike the perfect balance of being interactive but not nosy. The servers we have had are also lovely. After several rounds of drinks and shared plates we were sent a digestif  which was nice. 

Definitely a place we will return to if we are hosting friends,  but not a contender to be a regular stop.

With the Las Vegas bar scene filled with speedy "Here's your drink, Next!" type bartending, it's refreshing to see the art of craft cocktails being practiced at Herbs & Rye. All the cocktails are organized by time period adding character to the menu, and to be honest, you can't go wrong with anything on the cocktail menu. The best time to go is happy hour from midnight to close where steaks and other items are half off. Go for the steaks. Every steak I've ordered is cooked PERFECTLY! Some of the best steaks I've had have come from Herbs & Rye and they don't even consider themselves a steakhouse. This is my go to place when I'm looking for a classier place with great food and drinks. Herbs & Rye is a Vegas gem.

Had a great time here...I am not much of a drinker but I do like my Whiskey...

The Menu needs to be fixed as I could not read it..the font was hard to read and the red letters made it impossible..I thought because I was not wearing my glasses was the reason, so i asked the guy next to me and he said the same thing.....so fix that and all is good...

I asked the bar tender what was a good drink for whiskey he made me a Brown Derby it was really good..I saw a lot of cool drinks

The Brussels spourtts are definitely  must have no they are a try them before you try anything else kinda thing and I am not a brussel sprout kinda guy.

My new place for a steak as there happy hour has steaks at half price

Good cocktails, good food, good service. My husband got a very, very respectable Old Fashioned. We drink these every night... no, seriously, EVERY night, which means that we've had Old Fashioned at cocktail bars all over the country. We're a tough crowd and we'd probably rank this a 7.5. Good, good stuff. I had an excellent cocktail but, of course, forgot the name. We got the bisteca flatbread and some fries to share. Fries: Good. Flatbread: Very good. 
Service was friendly, prompt, and helpful. We are at the bar and the bartenders took good care of us, even throwing a couple of drinks our way when the entire bar was toasting a birthday girl, and we were the odd men out. How cool! 
We did have some trouble with the bill, which took a couple iterations to get right, but they were very sweet, apologetic, and accommodating. Nobody's perfect and, quite frankly, I dealt with something similar at another establishment earlier that day, which was not dealt with with nearly the same humility and helpfulness--so I was happy and charmed. 
In all, we really had a great night. The best part, really, was the warmth of the whole staff. My husband's family lives on the same side of town, and we are frequently looking for a late-night joint to escape to after his folks go to bed. This place definitely tops the list. We can't wait to come back.  The cocktail list looks like a blast and I'm looking forward to many joyful samplings.
Everything was perfect i was running late to my reservation they gave me extra time....the service was awesome the food was delicious it was the perfect valentine
Late after watching my girl JLo, both of us east coast people, we celebrated at here. Steaks after midnight priceless! Try the jalapeño creme corn!!

BEST STEAKS in LAS VEGAS. PERIOD

Forget shelling out $80 - $100 for a rib eye at a fancy steak house on the strip, for you steak lovers out there, this is the place to be.

The place can get a little bit hectic at times, and service is a hit or miss but it's their happy hour that makes up for it all. Trust me, every other time I'm in that place, you won't see their servers for a while because their running around like chickens with their heads cut off. I ain't gonna lie, it makes me mad in the beginning waiting for our food and drinks but once you take a bite of their steaks you just zone the hell out and forget everything bad that just happened.

Yeah it's that good, I work in the hospitality industry too and service is one of the things I look for while dining out at other places. 

Happy Hour is 5pm - 8pm and 12am - 3am everyday with the exception of Sundays (closed)

50% off all steaks, and a few apps.

Weapon of Choice: 14 oz NY strip, medium rare, with a side of peruvian chimichurri and creamed corn. This ain't your graveyard casino $3.99 steak and eggs NY strip, I honestly don't know how they get the NY strip so damn tender. It eats like a Rib Eye but with less the fat. 

All in all, for about $21 for a steak, side, and topper, you cannot go wrong with that.

I will be in here frequently, say hi if you ever run into me =]

I went here with my wife and sat at the bar.  Great romantic atmosphere.  This place has all of the prohibition Era drinks and the bartender was fabulous. A lot of local people here and ...not the strip.  The happy hour prices are a great value.  I had the meatball appetizer with a Boulevardier and that was a perfect combination of food and drink. The  ribeye with garlic mash and the Brussel sprouts for dinner.    Great food/service/people/ambiance.
The cocktails here are amazing, next visit had the food... WOW! The service is awesome drinks where great and the happy hour prices are amazing!!

New favorite steakhouse in Vegas. Slightly off the strip, worth the trip! Had the linguine and clams, and can't even believe the Bruschetta flat bread. So delicious, romantic atmosphere, prohibition style (very full) bar, get there early for half priced steak from 5-8 pm! Cooked to perfection with amazing service to top it off! Thanks for a great experience!

Cool unpretentious bar with an extensive menu of classic drinks. The people serving are very helpful and will take the time to explain some of the more detailed or unfamiliar drinks without making you feel stupid. This bar is a class act!

Came here with a friend for the first time and didn't know what to expect... but I sure wasn't expecting a vampire dungeon castle with class... 

This joint definitely looked hip and I was curious from the moment I took a step through the door. My party and I were immediately greeted by a hostess and then we made our way to the bar. The bartenders were ready to serve us as soon as we parked our batooki's on the bar stools. 

I personally ended up ordering the stake salad flatbread, which was divine and 
a glass of chardonnay that was not such a great recommendation from the B-tend, but it was still good enough for me to drink it up. My buds had 4 french beers between them and calamari.  

Overall the bill for 1 glass of wine, 4 beers, calamari + 1 flat bread was $70 tip not included in calculation which is a little steep, but I thought it was worth it because the aesthetics made it feel like it was worth spending the extra green. The food did take a bit long to arrive, but it was no biggie. I definitely dig this joint and will be coming back real soon.

Loved this place! The food is a little pricey, but delicious. (I'm not really a steak person so I ordered the penne pasta, which was amazing.) The cocktails are superb yet shockingly affordable given typical Vegas prices, and our server (who was super friendly) made great drink recommendations. I love that Herbs & Rye's cocktail menu spans over a century of different libations; where else can you get a mini history lesson while deciding on what to drink? The vibe of this place is very cool and upbeat; we visited on a Monday night and it was pretty busy. If you're a tourist, do yourself a favor and make the off-strip trip. Herbs & Rye is definitely worth your time!

Herbs and Rye is the place to go if you have a late night craving for some great food and don't want to eat fast food.  After midnight they have the Happy Hour which is 50% off select items on your menu.  I tried the gnocchi the first time I ate there and fell in love.  I know where to get my late night italian fix now when i'm craving it.  I also had the rib eye steak which was Delicious and cooked perfectly.  Not to mention it was one of the 50% off happy hour items.  I always get the sweet potato tator tots everytime i'm there.

The well drinks are also half off during happy hour.  If you want to try something different get the Russian Mule.  Its a citrus tasting drink with vodka and ginger beer served in a brass mug with crushed ice.  I tried one for the first time and it instantly became a favorite.    

Check this place out if you are on that side of town which is central Las Vegas, not too far from the strip.  Happy Hour specials are awesome.  Food is great.  Drinks are great.  And the history about place is kind of cool also, knowing that it used to be an old Mob/Gangster hang out back in the day.

We went back for dinner to give the restaurant another chance.  I don't eat beef or pork so I had lobster over garlic mashed potatoes which was delicious and my husband had the double cut pork chop which he said was great.  I had the Thai wings again and they were very good.  The Pina Colada I had was one of the best I have had. They do make great drinks! 

We went on a Wednesday night and it was packed but I did notice people being seated right away.  Our service was very good.

It was a lot better experience this time around and we would go back.  The food is definitely good!

Love coming to this place. Great atmosphere, the staff is ridiculously friendly and its got a fantastic menu that is late night and great happy hour. I want to come out here more often. The steaks are amazing. If you're coming here you better have a drink and steak!

Came here with hubby on an impromptu date. 
I was apprehensive when we got here, I felt that any moment a slasher lurking between the cars  will be attacking you as it was so dark at the parking lot. 
Once you get inside the restaurant, it was quite nice. Dark but beautiful interior. We were lucky to get seated at the back room area where it's quieter. We came before 8PM and some appetizers and steaks were half priced! Cool!
We ordered the spicy mussels for appetizer and it was so delicious! The serving size was  good enough for  sharing for 2 people, the red sauce was so flavorful my hubby had to ask for extra bread for dipping and ate it with gusto!
I had the filet mignon and hubby was partial to rib eye, both steaks were cooked to perfection. 
No condiments needed. I like the sides of  button mushrooms and the truffle mac & cheese.  We were so full we did not have room for desserts. 
Our server was nice and regularly checked on us. 

I'm docking 1 star as service is a bit slow: the food took a while to come out;  the
entrées were pricey (unless you come during happy hour), the background music were not conducive to a romantic date  (they were playing 70's song like Anita Ward's "Ring My Bell" when we were dining there! Ugh! )  and  the exterior is creepy - I think they should add more lights at the parking area for safety reasons.
Other than these, I think it's worth coming back to. I'll try their cocktails and desserts next time.

Always a wonderful time. Fillet is so tender you don't even need a knife. Flatbread superb. I always have a hard time deciding on all the delicious sides I have to order seveal. Always have to get the outrageously delicious creamed corn with japaleno.
Definitely a little gem!  Fantastic food, wonderful happy hour and certainly affordable.  This might be my new favorite!

So we didn't get a steak, blasphemy I know. But we did try the wedge salads loaded with bacon, red onions, blue cheese crumbles and tasty blue cheese dressing, and we also each had an order of buffalo wings. Hit the spot and satisfied my buffalo wing craving. The wings were big and juicy, a decent portion for the price. Service was great, super friendly. Definitely a cool spot to check out if you are visiting Vegas.

Our friends rave about this place and now I know why.  We went here with the in-laws because they are steak and potatoes people.  My father-in-law is a former beef farmer.  He knows his stuff about beef. He was very happy with his steak. We each got a steak and side. I got two sides. We were impressed at how simple everything was prepared, but was so flavorful. Service was good and the cocktails were delish! We will definitely be back!

I don't really know how I feel about this place. Our server Mark was great and even remembered our names, I think that's really the only positive.  We ordered the linguine and clams and the truffle Mac and cheese which were mediocre. We came here around midnight on a Friday night for their happy hr from 12am-3am. The bar was packed so we had to get a table which is fine, but it was so ridiculously loud in there that you can't even hear the person next to you. This is primarily because of the rowdy people at the bar. Then there's really no explanation of the happy hr on the menu so we thought this included cocktails...which it doesn't. Also, they don't even have prices for them on the menu....strange. Cocktails weren't great anyway, I didn't even finish mine. Would I recommend this place? No. Maybe I would try this place again just for their steak, but not for drinks or ambiance.

The food here is really delicious! The decor is fantastic, and the service was exceptional. Had a wonderful birthday dinner with complementary shots of fernet branca and fresh made doughnuts! We will be back, this is my new favorite place.

I came here last night for part 2 of Nelson Q's UYE. It was happy hour and we had GOOD TIMES!!

What I ordered:

3 - Moscow Mule $9 (3rd one from my boy Matt S and 1st one from H&R for Yelpers)
      vodka, lime, ginger beer
1 - Blue Moon $5
1 - Carpaccio $6
      thinly sliced beef, balsamic glaze, cherry pepper aioli, arugula
1 - Harlem (shot from Jieun L)

The Moscow Mule was very tasty. It was served in this cool mug. The Carpaccio was a little too salty. We wanted Jager shots but they didn't have it. The bartender suggested Harlem, which wasn't as good as Jager. 

I will mos def come back for the Ribeye during happy hour!

Great place for a late night drink but otherwise it completely blows!!  The service sucks and when we asked the waitress what do you have that's Italian she said well not much.....won't be coming back here again!!!!  Linguine and clams came in the shells?!!  Really?!  Bring on the Artisan!!
Great service, food, and atmosphere. Shout out to Mark. Thanks for making our special night great.

Sprouts and ham was delicious.  Spicy clams was excellent.  A must order!  Rib eye was flavorful.  If you add blue cheese to any steak... Order it on the side.  The flavor is too overwhelming with the steak.  Clams linguini lacked flavor.  Order after midnight for the 1/2 off steaks.  Pricey place...

Was not impressed with this place. Parking is terrible (in an alley) and despite only having to wait 20 minutes for a table, it took over an hour from the time of ordering to get our food. When it finally did come, it was wrong (added a spicy rub that wasn't asked for). I didn't send it back because I didn't want to wait another hour for my steak. When I was finally able to catch up with the waiter, he said he had put my order in correctly and I must have gotten someone else's steak. Upon getting the bill, (which also took way longer than it should have) nothing "adjusted" to acknowledge the mistake and poor service. Food was decent, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go back.

Everything was delicioso, from the apps (brusschetta,romaine salad tomato soup) to the steaks (rib eye and new york)
But the item that stole the night was the side of brussels sprouts.....amazing flavor!!!!!.
Our server Mark was on point.
Nice decor.
Only con, after the second bite of our apps  main course was deliver.
I definetely would recomend this place.

You cannot beat this place during their happy hour. Old time movies playing on the tv screens and a menu that points out that their steaks are half off during their happy hour. Our waiter was super awesome because he totally realized that I am frugal. When ordering a drink, he let us know if a drink was going to be half off or not, which I totally appreciated. I have frequented places that will happily "do you dirty" and not mention when something isn't part of their special to jack up the price of the bill. Food was pretty decent. Only complaint is that it was super dark in there. We needed our phones to look at the menu.

Perfect first date if you wanna impress your girl... They have a wide variety of drinks and it's super fun to pick a variety of different ones and share. Bartenders are awesome and the absinthe is quiet the show !!

If you want a good cocktail, look no further. Sit at the bar, talk to the bartender, they'll steer you in the right direction. The people making the drinks are smarter, friendlier, and more talented than the price tag attached to an evening spent here. I had three cocktails and an appetizer, the littleneck clams, and let me tell you, my guy Nick (I think that was his name) had the art down. He picked people up, got neighbors at the bar socializing, and made a good show of making some of the best drinks I've ever had the pleasure of drinking. Do a little googling and notice that the biggest bartenders in Vegas recommend this place for a serious cocktail; then drop in, relax, and let the joy of seriously crafted food, drink, and atmosphere  wash over you.

Take advantage of the happy hour steak specials and you'll walk out thinking you came out on top every time.... Although, if you add a few menu'd cocktails then you're  about even.  Pricey drinks.
Atmosphere was extremely dark but cozy.  Do not sit at a booth around the bar!  With happy hour getting a bit busy, you're sure to have your table getting bumped into several times and spend your night reading the back of several shirts.  But I got really lucky and got to see some chica's ass as she climbed up a bar stool like she was Stallone in Cliffhanger allowing her short skirt to ride up lol. 
The steaks were great, ordered the ribeye with a blue cheese crown, and the filet.  Each come with a side to which we got the mashed potatoes, and jalapeño corn, also added the truffle mac (you know).  All the sides were a lil.... Eh.  Mashed:  we're they suppose to be garlic mashed cuz they almost had no garlic in em... Corn wasn't creamy enough and truffle Mac was bland n dry. Sides need work.  Oh but the calamari was on point! Great flavors on that dish.  Finished off with the donuts and hey, how can you go wrong with donuts.  I'd go back for sure but only during the happy hours.  The Moscow mule is already calling my name again.

I've read multiple write ups on this restaurant and decided to check it out. I STRONGLY suggest reservations as the place as it is always packed. 

Called a week in advance to make a reservation and it was some how lost. The hostess did some magic and with a small wait at the bar was able to get us seated. 

I cannot rave enough about the cocktails. We tried 4 different drinks and fell madly in love with them all. 

The steak is mouth watering and came out perfectly cooked. Ronnie was an attentive waiter and offered great service. 

We will definitely be back again and again.

I went to herb and rye with a few friends for a birthday party, being that I rarely eat chicken let alone any other meat I was bit weary. 

When we walked in the steak house has the ambiance of a haunted house with there being almost NO LIGHTING,old antique decorations, and creepy paintings. The menu is very brief but VERY DIFFICULT to read with the lack of lights. 

I did find a pasta dish on the menu and ordered that, much to my delight. Also found an alcoholic drink that was very tasty. I made the mistake of telling the waiter I needed more time while everyone else ordered their first round of drinks and I didn't get another chance to order for about 20 minutes, also takes a solid 15 minutes for the bartender to make it. 

Over all great food and drinks how ever the ambiance and service time suffer badly, also pretty pricey it was $450 for 5 people. A great place to go for a special occasion, but wouldn't go for a random dinner.

Very impressed! Happy hour was fantastic! Half of dinner had so many options and the drinks were delicious. Ordered a Moscow Mule, may just be my new favorite. Debra the waitress was attentive and friendly. We dined in the bar area which was a little loud but the overall ambiance was nostalgic. I would definitely go back !!

Great happy hour deal especially for the late night 12-3am one because of the chill music and the video-accompanied mixes by the DJ. Got the Kansas bone-in 12oz steak with truffled mac and cheese for $14.50. It was decently cooked (medium rare) but I don't think I would have been happy paying the full price for it.

I went for the first time a couple nights ago and it was late night happy hour, so we waited about 45 minutes to be seated so that I didn't like. Once we were seated the food and drinks were awesome. I ordered the filet mignon and it was perfectly cooked with jalapeño cream corn. All around great experience I will go back. The only thing I didn't like was the location, but you can't win everything.

I finally made it to Herbs and Rye!  From the outside, I was not sure this was going to be my kind of place.  Don't let the location and sketchy exterior scare you away.  Once you open the doors, it's like stepping in to another city.  My favorite thing about Herbs and Rye is that it is very different than any other bar I've been to in Las Vegas.  Very cool and dark and love the way it's decorated.  

The drinks were strong and moderately-priced, but to be honest, I was not as impressed with the happy hour food menu.  I expected the majority of the menu to be 50% off and that wasn't the case.  The things I wanted, Bruschetta and Calamari, were not 50% off but I got them anyway.  And I'm glad I did.  Both great and far better than I expected from bar food.  The service was really great too.  We met the owner while we were here, and he seemed like a cool dude.  Gave us some of the history of the place.  I don't love Herbs and Rye yet, but I will definitely come back here to give it another shot.  Very cool, unique place.

I love this place for cocktails. The bartenders are wonderful and the ambiance is amazing. On my latest dining experience, our server brought me a glass of Reisling and brought my friend a glass of Merlot. We both ordered Pinot Noir. We both wanted steaks, but all of the steaks are 12 to 20 ounces. These portions are much two large for two single girls, out having a nice meal together. If you opt to share an entree, there is an extra $7 fee. I recommend they add prime rib to their menu and get smaller ounce cut options for their steaks.

So I've been hearing about this place for a while for fellow Yelpers and been wanting to try. When I finally got the chance, we ended up having plans to go twice in the same week! If my rating was based solely on service they would've got a 1.5, based on drinks 4.5, based on food 3.
My first time there we were with a very large group ( 30+ people) on a Tuesday night at 8pm. It's not like they didn't know we were coming, but they seemed overwhelmed. They couldn't keep up with our drink orders, it took way too long to get the orders in let alone get the drink (even if it was just bourbon on the rocks). It took a long time to get our food as well, some people in our group were done and leaving when we didn't even get our food yet. They ran out of sides. Brought out sides way before our entree so the side was cold. Steaks were overdone. My lobster tail was over cooked. The food was just  "meh". We were all happy with the drink selection and drinks...when we got them.
I was turned off with that first try, but I gave them a pass since it was such a large group. And went back with some friends on Friday night around 7:30. Again, service was horrible. It took forever to get our drink orders, and it was nearly impossible to get the waiters attention if you wanted anything else. Once we ordered food, the food also took forever. I got the Calamari this time and the first time and it was good both times. I also got a Prosciutto and Asparagus Flatbread, it was good, nothing exciting, but good. My husbands steak was much better this time and his side, Broccoli and Cheese was yummy. A friend at our table never got his food when we were all done eating, so he cancelled his order. My drinks were perfect (order 2 drinks at a time because they take so long to get!) Brown Derby and Blinker, both good in their own way. It was our friends birthday so we all split some Donuts....they were awesome.
I like the decor and old fashioned vibe. I've been to this locale before it was Herbs And Rye...boy has it changed! 
The service alone would keep me from going back, not sure if I will go back. Only time will tell. Good thing they have some loyal Yelpers as patrons because they turned off a room full of people.

It was good service from the second we arrived and it was almost a full house. The portions were a little smaller but form happy hour specials they were bigger than most places. We both had the fillet and it was prepared excellently. The chocolate chip cookie desert is made fresh per order and worth the 10 min wait!

Speakeasy in Vegas? HA! Yeah right. I was proven correct and would not recommend coming here for any speciality drinks. Reserve that for bartenders on the Strip.

I suppose the service was nice... but I'm not sure if this place has any much else going for it. They serve absinthe. So what? Who doesn't nowadays.

I might come back here for a prefunk but wouldn't mind going to Little Macau for that either haha.

12/14/2011 update.
Just went in for happy hour, aiming to get the carpaccio and a flatbread. Last time I was in, these were awesome happy hour snacks, and priced as such. Both $5. (Flatbread in the interim had climbed to $10). Things are a changing at H&R. Now, they're each non-happy-hour-priced at around $13/ea, and the only happy hour appys are the mussels and the clam linguine. So much for the good ol' days. Not so happy hour. Sneakin' those prices up. Definitely not worth a $30 hit. I left when I discovered this new situation. Pffft.
Kind of disappointed. A lot of my friends told me to try this place and that it's worth it for the happy hours. Well... The food is good but it's too expensive !

First time visiting this place and I can't believe I drive by here nearly every day and hadn't checked it out yet.  Props to the Yelp friends for cluing me in on this place.  The decor inside is pretty amazing...I don't even know how to describe it.  Dark, gothic, speakeasy?  I don't know but whatever it is works great.  My friend and I came in here one evening at about 9:30 for a late dinner after work.  The lot is always full when I drive by; partly due to being somewhat small and partly because it seems everyone besides me knows how great this place is.  For this first visit I had one of their micro brew drafts (can't even remember the name); it was dark similar to Newcastle but better.  I also had one of their flatbreads and a house salad.  I try to keep it simple when going to new place so that I'm not disappointed (read: pissed) if I order something crazy and expensive and it turns out to be disappointing.  The food lived up to its reputation...everything tasted great, was fresh and presented nicely.  Service wasn't too shabby either however I did notice the bartender spending more time chatting with the hostess's than the guests...can't say I blame him, they were easy on the eyes but just saying people do notice this and can be off-putting to some.  Will return for another meal sometime soon.

Great experience. Went for a friends birthday celebration. Christian the manager made our night very special. Great food and great drinks. Extremely satisfied and have already recommended numerous friends and coworkers to enjoy their atmosphere as well.

The food was amazing which should be the most important thing ....however let me list the con's of this great establishment.

-Parking ...virtually nonexistent
-service... Slow at best
-Ambiance... Wayyyy to dark and gloomy
-Bar...mad crowded
-Large groups...not comfortable at all

I really wanted to love this joint because of the great reviews I read. Maybe if I come back with the wifey only and not a large group it will be better. IDK. But for now I'm sticking with my 2 stars.

Great meal the mussles were a perfect start.
My filet was delicious and melted like butter
Bread pudding with fresh apples made me tear up.
Nice old feeling bar worth it especially for happy hour...happy hour food is 50 percent to offer their includes steaks 
Nice haunt for us locals.
Old school Vegas!!  Great happy hour pricing!!  Fun place to go with friends!!
Love this place! Highly recommended, open late, intimate atmosphere and excellent service.

I can't believe that I have never reviewed this place. It's our go to steak house in Las Vegas. On top of that it's also one of our favorite all around restaurants in town. The steak happy hour is an awesome reason to visit. They also have a great full bar with a lot of vintage drinks. The sazerac is always great. Nectaly operates a great place. I hope that this place never closes!

Wonderful Decor, wonderful drink menu , wonderful service , amazing filet , amazing Brussels sprouts , delicious truffle Mac and cheese... Shall I go on? Ok go here it's amazing . Hipsters everywhere unite!

How disappointing!  I was so excited to try this place out, but the food was marginal at best.  The silverware was dirty and I had to return my wine because the glass still had lipstick on it from a previous guest. I will definitely not be back!

Don't judge a book by its cover. This is a great and reasonably priced dinner. We were in Vegas on vacation and tired of the prices on the strip. This is a must try. Some recommendations are the Mussels, Caprese salad and almost all steaks are half price during happy hour.

Items Selected:
Clover Club - Gin, Lemon, Raspberry Syrup, Egg White
The Farmer Flatbread - Double Thick Bacon, Spinach, Cracked Egg, Crème Fraiche
Truffled Mac n' Cheese
Pork and Figs - Gorgonzola, Garlic Mash, Fig Glaze
Sweet Potato Tots with Marshmallow and Honey Crust
Old Granddad Bread Pudding with Vanilla Ice Cream
 
Heavily praised for an extensive era-specific list of craft cocktails with a menu full of sustainable organic meats and plates far more interesting than the average bar or lounge Herbs & Rye had long been a place of interest and with recent reports suggesting the kitchen to be firing on all cylinders I finally decided to stop by, a Saturday feast for one in the dimly-lit dining area my reward for eschewing alternative plans on Las Vegas Boulevard South.  Designed in a style somewhere between "Old time Vegas" and stripped-down speakeasy with a less-than-ideal location on West Sahara it was with eyes still adjusting from the 6pm sun that I entered the small tavern and greeted at a small podium by the woman later to be my waitress I was quickly led to my choice of tables, a menu soon in hand presenting tough decisions with a resultant four item order divided into two courses accompanied by one of nearly a dozen gin based cocktails I'd have liked to try were my liver's capacity on par with that of my gut.  Obviously a space prone to becoming lively as the night wears on but only perhaps half-full during the course of my meal it was after perhaps a ten minute wait that my cocktail arrived and featuring a lovely balance of fruit juxtaposing juniper notes beneath a cloudy of foam the Clover Club was a hit, the flavor profile particularly refreshing when matched to a rich opening duo of tender macaroni unfortunately overwhelmed with truffle oil and a crisp, lightly charred flatbread that fared far better with briny bacon finding its foil in the tang of crème fraiche.   At this point debating an Aviation versus the Bee's Knees it was a bit to my surprise that my second round arrived immediately on the heels of my first and forgetting the second cocktail as it was likely to arrive far too late to be enjoyed with the food I instead dug straight in, the 12oz bone-in piece of pork seared perfectly and coated with bleu over hand-smashed potatoes amidst a jus of pork and poached figs, the later laying split alongside the protein and still intensely sweet...though certainly not as much so as a bowl of tender tots bathed in a pool of honey beneath snowcaps of toasted marshmallow that ranks amongst the best "sides" I've had this year.  At this point sated but happy to go another round it was to an oral explanation of the restaurant's desserts that I was finally treated and although large sharing portions of sugared doughnuts and a skillet cookie were hard to resist it was instead in the day's special that I partook, the piping hot chunk of booze-soaked baguette crowned by a ball of vanilla ice cream proving very 'special' indeed with butter and cinnamon bubbling at its base as if the kitchen had known I was coming and prepared it just for me.

Consistency is a rare commodity, and Herbs & Rye steakhouse endures the old school steakhouse and bar. 
The minimal interior (velvet wallpaper is my favorite) and masculine atmosphere is old school Vegas.  This town needs to be back in The Rat Pack days;) 
Emily easily achieves to strike a chord with the customers at Herbs & Rye!  She has the ability to mix and serve a cocktail, all the while exuding a rare charm. 
Their menu will please any carnivore's cravings  with outstanding cuts.
This is nestled away from the Strip and by all means if one is visiting the Strip- please do make a point of coming into this gem.

Definitely a local gem and an all time fav of me and my SO. If planning to go during happy hour (seriously the best happy hour in Vegas and the best deal if planning to dine here, IMO), be sure to make a reservation! This place gets busy and parking can be a bit hard to come by when its busy, so try to car pool or take a cab. 

The outside makes it look a bit shady, but I love the dark, moody decor and lighting inside. Such a big part of a great dining experience to me. All the servers we've had have always been super nice and extremely helpful with any questions and offering up suggestions. 

We always get a few different cocktails (even though they aren't included in the happy hour specials). We like our drinks on the sweeter side, so some of our favorites are the Zombie, Harvey Wallbanger, Painkiller, and Mark Pickford. On occasion, when we're feeling adventurous, we'll go for the Bartender's Choice. 

For food, the Wedge Salad is always our favorite way to start. It never disappoints. And my SO always goes for the NY strip and I get the filet, topped with onions and mushrooms. For sides, the garlic mash is always solid and the sweet potato tots are good too. The steaks have always been cooked perfectly to our liking and are tender and flavorful. They offer lots of add-on options for the steaks as well.

The only negative is that it is a bit pricey when not dining during happy hour. I spent significantly more dining here when it wasn't happy hour, than I did dining at Vinter Grill, which is a more upscale restaurant.

Not only is the owner one of our best customers, his place is awesome! Happy Hour drinks and half price steaks are the way to go. My filet was cooked perfectly and was one of the best steaks I've had! Wait staff was friendly, attentive and fast. I will definitely be back.

What an exceptional experience!  Searching for an off the strip steak house and found this place. Looks can be deceiving from the outside and make you think twice. But once you walk inside you feel you stepped into a 1920s speakeasy. The bar tenders are true mixologist who know how to make all the classics.  Order the steak just like you want it and is delivered perfect.  I tend to order my steak under done so it comes our correct, but not here. Exactly the way you ordered is how it is prepared. Next time in Vegas I'm bringing my customers! Great specials during happy hour from 5 to 8.

I have no word to describe how great the food, drinks and service was!!!! Besides that they opened 15 mins late everything was awesome! We had the calamari for an appetizer was to die for! We got a NY strip with garlic mashed and a flat bread both were so good!!
This is a hidden gem. Great atmosphere and fun clientele. Emily is the best bar tender with flair!

Today was bad. Just bad. Not sure if short staff was to blame or just our server, but never had a worse experience here. Waited 25 min (at our booth) for our first drinks. Food was good but steak was doused in oil from mushroom & onions, otherwise as good as always. Service just sucked! We had more interaction and service from bus boy (awesome should get server status) and hostess! Sorry for bad review but when things are bad ya gotta say something. Best part.... Server never even acknowledged the slow service or anything, someone give that bus boy a raise! Full price on the check too! Boo herbs & rye tonight!

Happy hour 5 pm - 8 am and midnight to 3 am.

My buddy and I decided to have a man date one night but we couldn't wait for the reverse happy hour because both of us had to work the next day. Well, it was just me. 

We were greeted promptly and sat on a semi-circle. It was an awkward setting for us two. it seriously felt like a date.

Shared a plate of Carpaccio (beef, arugula, balsamic). Mmmm-mmmm-mmm. At first, I couldn't find the meat, I thought it was just a plate of arugula. But because of the dim lighting, it was really there, under the arugulas. But my oh my, delish and refreshing.  It was a hint of bitterness, sweetness and saltiness. All my senses were confused in the right way.

As for drinks we got two...can't remember exactly what the names were mine was Scowoff? Scawhoff? S something. Even our server corrected me. My buddy got the drink with that comes with fire. Anyway, my drink was like a manhattan but with lemony goodness. 

Gosh, I wasn't even drunk but it sounds like I was based on this review. Haha. I would come back here to see what the happy hour is all about. Maybe have a plate of meat for me or clams.

This is my favorite restaurant in all of Vegas. The food is very good and the drink list/menu are untouchable for anywhere in town. This is a little off the beaten path, so if you are a tourist visiting, not only is it difficult to find, but a little tough to allow for the time away from the strip and everything else Vegas has to offer. Came here during NADA this year and was pleasantly surprised that my group of 8 was able to walk in, without reservations and enjoy a fantastic meal. We all ended up sharing things from steak to pasta to chicken. I also introduced a coworker to absinthe. They make it traditionally, so you get a show with the cocktail as well. Everything is so well done here, from the food to the drinks to the meticulously decorated interior. I absolutely love Herbs & Rye!

I just can't say enough good things about this place,  but for starters 50:% off the good menu for Happy hour which includes   their steak,  how can you go  wrong???  And by the way,  the steak is the amazing part!! I've had the ribeye twice with blue cheese crust and it's perfect,  actually probably best steak I've had in Vegas.  We had the spinach,  jalapeño corn,  button mushrooms,  truffle Mac and cheese,  broccoli and cheddar and they were all great,  mushrooms being the best :)  the ambiance is great totally unexpected for the area and the waiter was fabulous,  we ordered 2 desserts the chocolate chip cookies with ice cream,  which was magical omg and the bread pudding which  was ok....  The only thing they keep it like an ice room in there so bring a sweater!!  You will not be disappointed,  oh and happy hour ends at 8pm!!!

Customer service based. Great bar food. I would not come here for my anniversary dinner but I would definitely eat here multiple times a week for anything from a business dinner to god times with friends. Incredible cocktails and a fun old school Vegas ambiance. I can not believe they offer coupons on Restaurant.com but you might as well take advantage of them. Times must be tough. This is a consitant place and well worth your hard earned money.
Best classic cocktails in town. Be patient they take time. Food is good. Ambiance is perfect

We ask the locals where to hang out and have nice steak dinner they're replied was Herbs & Rye. We made dinner reservations for 2 at 8:30 PM just in case. We arrived there and waited 20 mins for a table a little annoyed but once seated we order drinks and main course. The food and service was good.  I order side bacon with my steak it was only a small strip but it was good. I wanted a slab of bacon like the one at old homestead steakhouse. But overall it was a great place to have dinner off the strip.

This place never disappoints! Great food, price, and atmosphere! The only downfall is the long wait to be seated. I made reservations at 7 PM, didn't get seated until 7:20 PM - not a big deal but can see how people may get frustrated especially if you're hungry. Definitely will come back again!

Okay...knocked another one of my bookmarked places off the bucket list last Friday.  I am only rating the drinks as I did not try any food nonetheless well crafted cocktails flow here.  I had a triple play of ward eight, remember the Maine and some offshoot of a sazerac cocktail.  I enjoyed the ambiance and talking with Nectaly.  I will be back for drinks and will bring a flashlight to read the menu...heard good comments on the food.

Best Happy Hour Ever!!!

Located not too far from the strip (like 5 to 10 minutes away) great place for locals and tourist. Lots of parking!

My friends and I have been here lots of times because it's one of our favorite restaurants. Also, it is a great place to bring your family because they have lots of seating and kid friendly. They also have a private area if you want to throw a party. Great place to go on dates because the lighting is dim and great music! So far everyone that I have recommended this place to has never been disappointed. The service is excellent, they will never leave your glass empty. 

Happy hour is from 5PM- to 8PM and 12AM to 3AM(for you late night eaters), which is half off food menu which are the items with a star next to it! 

Must try Items:
Chicken Wings, Ribeye, Flatbread, Calamari, pretty much everything on the menu because yes it is that delicious!
Excellent food and happy hour is amazing. Only criticism would be wait times on drinks when they are busy.

Nice place BUT ... Been here twice and they had a sign on the doors both times saying they were "opening late due to technical difficulties" 

Night 1 - bartenders got in a fight so they had to open late. 

Night 2 - they had a party night before she hadn't cleaned up in time. 

They open at 5 pm. That's plenty of time to clean during the day???

Great food and great service. Happy Hour is everyday with 50% off on most menu items. Our server, was phenomenal from the beginning and recommended the perfect wine to go with our meal. They are starting to feature live music but the volume doesn't over power the ambiance of the place.

We ordered the calamari...one of the best I've had in the valley. It didn't have your typical marinara sauce, but instead was tossed with slivers of banana peppers and an aoli sauce...excellent. For the main course we had the sirloin (they recommended the rib-eye but had ran out by then) and the fettucini "crabonara". We didn't feel rushed and the food came out perfect.

Definitely coming back here again to try everything else. Their menu items weren't your typical italian fair and they served probition era type drinks and cocktails which were interesting...it also helped they were 50% off.

Herbs and Rye has the destinction of being a wonderful purveyor of great crafted classic and modern cocktails.  Our waiter was very knowledgable and the service was good.  We went during happy hour and split a couple of half price entrees which made the evening rather inexpensive.   If you don't go during happy hour the food prices can really add up.  The food was good, we had a steak and the gnocci both of which were quite tasty.  The vibe of the place is laid back and comfortable.  If you're a cocktail drinker, then this place is right up there with the Artisan and the Downtown Cocktail room.

Made reservations here for nothing basically since we had to wait an hour anyway when we got there. The male hostess was non responsive and doesn't give you updates on your table. BUT they did a good job in making up for it in comping a good amount of our meal. Plus the food was great.

My girlfriend found this place during our last trip to Vegas, and it has officially became our MUST VISIT!

We came here after the Vegas night clubs during the late night happy hour from 12AM-3AM, and it has one of the most amazing happy hour menu. All items listed with 2 stars are 50% off - which includes their steaks. But wait, there's more! The half off steak also includes a choice sides. We ended up spending about ~$50 for a 16oz Ribeye, and a 14oz New York Strip with two sides (Mushroom and Creamed Corn). I was speechless! The steaks were delicious! I would say they were on par with Flemings steakhouse, and for the price that can't be beat.

I'm savoring about the steaks as i'm writing this review. Looking forward to my next Vegas trip to come!

Love the vibe here. Not what you expect from the outside. It's got the 20's prohibition theme here. Spicy mussels and meatball appetizers are a must! It's the first time I've tried Moscow mule. Pretty good!!!! It's quite pricey but I like the vibe and the food so is say it's worth it!

I can't say enough about this place... Mark and Joseph made for an amazing end to a great night in Vegas. Good food... Good drinks... What more can you ask for. 

Husband loved his steak. Truffle Mac and cheese so good... Even if no truffle. Lol still so good. Garlicky spinach lives up to its name. Sausage flatbread great. 

Cocktails just as good. Tell them what you like and they'll master it. Mark's berry Moscow mule was to die for. They are definitely masters of their craft. 

We'll be back on our next visit for sure!!!
Happy hour (HH) menu is VERY limited! Music is loud and unfitting with the speakeasy vibe. Streak and appetizers were good, cocktails were surprisingly lacking. Service is very slow.

First time here and really loved it. Happy hour lasts until 8:00 and thoroughly enjoyed a perfectly cooked new York steak for half price! It even includes one side. The decor is very stylish with brick walls and a beautiful bar area. Staff very friendly too.
Love the atmosphere of this place. Drinks are tasty and meatballs are a must try!

Sooo, Herbs & Rye is one of my favorite date restaurants. 

It's not in the nicest part of town and the parking really sucks, but, you kind of forget all that when you walk inside. 

Like I said before, it's a perfect place for date night. Dimly lit and the decor is pretty cool. Every time I've gone the service has always been excellent, bartenders to servers, everyone is really gracious and polite. 

Ok so, the drinks, yeeeah, they're pretty expensive, but! They're made well and they offer a lot of unique choices so, you really do get what you pay for, in my humble opinion. If you have savvy sophisticated drinkers in your life, this is definitely a spot to take them to. Oh, and let's talk about their food menu.

Holy hell, they have really amazing food here. I haven't been disappointed yet. Try the flat bread pizzas. They are scrumptious. 

So yeah, it's an intimate type of place so definitely come here with your significant other and get bonus points for picking such an awesome place to eat.

Not their best showing. Waitress left a LOT to be desired. Had to ask for a 2nd beer two times and never got it. Asked for bread 3 times. No go! Medium steaks are apparently red and mushy in the middle. Don't ask for a deviation from the menu, won't happen. All told, very disappointed. I'll give it or more shot, MAYBE, but would never recommend it based on this trip. Sorry.

I've only been here once, so I'm going straight to the 5 stars, but I have nothing negative to say about this place. It's awesome!! Granted I had the happy hour menu items, so pricing wasn't an issue as those are some good deals, but I could see a dinner getting a little pricey here. Still the service, cocktails, and ambiance make it worth it. 
I had the wings and beef carpaccio, the wings were fine good flavors and crispy, but the beef carpaccio was AMAZING, loved every bite. Perfectly thin slices covered in a truffle mayo drizzle on a bed of arugula, sign me up!! 
Then I drank a Moscow Mule, the most perfect summer cocktail ever, and the glass it comes in is kind of cool too. I also had the Hemingway daiquiri, also very good but I must say the Mule was my favorite.  
The tv's behind the bar were playing TCM's (and 16 candles was on) and the History channel, very entertaining to watch while sipping on some drinks.  Our bartender was the owner, and he couldn't of been nicer, very attentive and still took time to chat up his patrons.
 I will definitely be coming back here to enjoy some more cocktails during their amazing happy hour.
