Love this place for steak recommend it all the time, but I have had a few bad experiences with the cook in the steaks as of late. One time I can understand but not 3 might not be recommending this place in the future!

We were pleasantly surprised that H & R was as advertised...great steaks at happy hour prices!  Yes, the outside of the place is not going to win any awards but inside makes up for it.  Christian, the host, is a good guy and Aly, our server, was a pleasure.  All in all, very enjoyable.

There are so many great restaurants in Vegas, especially steak houses, why bother with this place that advertises happy hour steak prices and specializes in Vegas scams? Hidden costs abound or are written in fine print in the menu which are difficult to read in the dimmed- light atmosphere. For instance, if you split a meal with someone, Herbs and Rye will hand you an empty plate to divide your servings and then add on a $7.00 charge for this extra plate. They also charge a 20 percent gratuity- which includes the tax - and is based on the full price of the meal and not the "happy hour" prices. The steak is merely ok, the drink servings are small. Seriously, why bother? It's Vegas and truly great places abound with no hidden surprises in your bill and fabulous food and drinks. I'll take Del Friscos or Hank's any day!

My bf told me about this place awhile back ago. We ended up going here for his birthday (last week) and we had an amazing time! The ambiance, food, drinks, and service was amazing!!! He got a steak with a side of truffle mac and cheese and garlic mashed potatoes (with a blood and sand coctktail) and I got the angel hair pasta (with Vieux Carr'e cocktail). EVERYTHING WAS DELICIOUS. He and I shared everything and we just about died with how delicious, flavorful, and well cooked everything was. The truffle mac and cheese is to die for. If I had to have a last meal, I'd definitely come here..and drink all their alcohol because the cocktails we had were so well made as well. Our server Mike had only been there for 3 weeks, but he was exceptional. Very nice and welcoming and he explained everything to us. He was funny as well. This place is worth the money. We will definitely come back again, happy hour or not. Loved it!

Had the best experience enjoying cocktails and dinner at Herbs & Rye. For on out-of-towner, this was an excellent stop to see a part of Vegas you don't get on the strip. Fantastic, expertly crafted cocktails from some very friendly bartenders. And the food was top-notch, too.

Really good place!
Drinks were good, creative.
The sweet potato tots were so good, as was the pork & figs. Happy hour deal of half off their steaks was amazing, the steak was very good.
Overall, loved the place, only bad thing I can say is it was and hour and a half after we sat down until we got our food, and they weren't very busy. We weren't exactly in a hurry, but the service was slow.

What to order: 

New York. Medium well. Steak rub. Chimichurri. 

Thank me later.

Herbs and rye is one of vegas' best gems. I usually stop by during the week since i know weekends tend to get a little crazy and you might have to wait awhile to get a seat. The parking lot is also quite small so finding a space might take a minute. But it's worth it to have a night at this spot. 

Once your inside you'll notice the dim lighting & the speak easy ambiance. The music isn't loud which sets the tone for conversation to take place. Sitting at the bar is usually my go to since the bartenders are so welcoming and engaging. Mark has been my bartender several times and is one of my favorite reasons to sit in his area. 

I've had at least 5 different cocktails there and was never disappointed. Everything they do is handcrafted and the prices are actually moderately priced. Usually from $10-15 which is actually a really low price point when you consider the mess they serve on the strip. 

It's a great place to have a chill night with good friends and excellent drinks. Overall I give this place 5 stars for service and quality
Came here for happy hour after a show on the strip, the food took awhile to come out & service wasn't that great. 3 stars for food & 1 star for service.

Drinks are better than the food...  That being said the food is more than passable and the drinks are fantastic so I definitely recommend this place as a change of pace from the usual over-the-top strip wannabes.  Vegetarian options were available if not especially numerous.

The service was perfectly attentive and the ambiance was nice with a dark speakeasy vibe.  However, as other reviewers have mentioned, the electro lounge music playing does not suit the vibe of the decor.  Put some sweet jazz tunes on and everything would fall into place.

Great place to kick it, eat and be served by first class people. 
BTW: This is my first yelp review.

Stay for the solid handcrafted cocktails and delicious pasta dishes. But while Herbs & Rye touts itself as a steakhouse, you might want to pass on their cuts. 

For the past year, I've been hearing great things about this local Vegas favorite. Styled after the Prohibition era, this dimly-lit Italian speakeasy offers some great seafood pasta, flatbreads, and drinks. They're also the only place I've ever eaten at that offers happy hour for their steaks. Unfortunately, the New York strip that I ordered was overseasoned and underwhelming. However, at half the retail price of $42, I couldn't complain too much. If you're struggling to decide on a side, get the truffle mac & cheese, which was beyond cheesy. 

For appetizers, the beef tartar was amazing. I also highly recommend the linguine & clams. The white wine and garlic sauce was superb. I usually try not to eat too much bread, but I couldn't resist dipping it in the sauce. And of course, the comprehensive list of cocktails was impressive. Organized by era, it features plenty of classics that will be sure to bring you back to the days of the Rat Pack. Service was great. Our waitress was able to squeeze in a few latecomers' orders to include the happy hour price. Happy hour runs from 5:00-8:00 pm so be sure drop in.

My absolute favorite hang out spot! Great service every single time & not to mention the food is always on point. Mark is my favorite bartender, he always knows what I want to drink :)
I can't live without the flat iron steak & the Brussels sprouts!

By far one of my favorite steak houses a to go while in Vegas! Open late hours, amazing food, great signature cocktails. Perfect for entertaining and it's a hole in the wall that you wouldn't expect to be so good! Best steak I have had in years! Will be coming back.

Cute little place; dark and quiet. My sister and I split a ribeye, mac & cheese, and dessert. Food was AMAZING!!! I'm from Missouri and it's hard to find a good steak on the west coast. Make sure to go during happy hour. Great time except the service was super slow. I ordered a glass a wine and waited about 15 minutes for it. The bar was not that busy either. I will be coming back :)

So it was a night of culinary adventures last Friday and I finally got time to yelp about it. It started off at Herbs and Rye, which I have driven past umpteenthousand times without even noticing. The inside is very swanky, almost a Rat-Pack feel, as if Sinatra should come out of the other room telling you to scram, you're in his seat. It's the kind of place where the booze is cold and the broads are hot. (Wow, I've been waiting FOREVER to use that line in conversation.)

The food was good. Maybe I was just looking at a bar menu, but the selection seemed to be kind of small. It seemed to be like: Appetizer, Flatbread Pizza, Big Fat Steak, the end. But I ordered the hot wings, which were satisfactorily spicy. I tried some of my friend's sweet potato tater tots, but wasn't sold on them.

But the drinks... oooh lordie. If you have more than two, be prepared to have a designated driver. I ordered a Long Beach Iced Tea, which when made right should have a subtle red/fuschia color to it. Too dark means it's a weak drink; too light means too much alcohol.

The drink came back and looked less like a cocktail and more like a serving of pink lemonade Crystal Light.

Needless to say, I only ordered one.

I'm not knocking the place. If I was invited back by friends, I'd certainly go. But for such a good first impression, it kind of fizzled out.

Okay it's one of the best stocked bars in Vegas - liquor wise. Their cocktail list is serious and well crafted. Now short cuts here. A true mixologist paradise for flavor and well executed drinks with attention to detail. 

Food- I only had the meatballs with chorizo and filet sliders.... I was stuffed and wanted to order other items to see if they were as good. I will be back to see!

This place is plain ridiculous and I love it.  The best place for happy hour hands down. 
We got the  wonderful  signature drinks.. too die for.. 
50% of steaks at Happy hour.. 
Parking is a challenge but worth the hassle
Love this place

We drive by here everyday so we finally decided to give it a try. Came in for happy hour and they had half off steaks. My friend got a Moscow mule and the ribeye medium with a side of garlic mashed potatoes. My husband got the ribeye medium rare with a side of truffle Mac n' cheese and I got the filet mignon with the brussels sprouts. My food was great! Loved the Brussels sprouts especially. The filet mignon was like butter. My friends ribeye was great, it was well season and cooked perfectly. Her mash potatoes were good too. My husband's truffle Mac n cheese was probably one of the better Mac n cheese we've ever had. His steak was ok. It had a giant silverskin running through it. He ate around it so it wasn't that bad lol. We also got the donuts for dessert and they were amazing! Really great deal if you come for the happy hour and the service was great as well.

A previous reviewer's characterization of Herbs & Rye as "old style mixology" is wholly accurate. Seek out this local gem for the drinks, whether at the bar or in the dinning room. If you visit the latter, you will have the opportunity to peruse their historically inspired drink menu, which includes anecdotes and legends all the way back to the 1800s. This is a place you should feel entirely comfortable ordering the "Bartender's Choice," a beverage custom selected and mixed to your personality. Our waiter was discerning enough to recognize that my girlfriend did not have the fruity pallette of the usual Ladies' Night patron and brought her a proper whiskey drink.
Appropriately,  the hospitality matches the mixology, fostering an incredibly welcoming and appreciative atmosphere. Our waiter Christian, who some keen locals might recognize from Makers and Finders, not only remembered me from the coffee shop, but took extra care to present my girlfriend and I some of his favorite samples from both the drink and dinner menu.
Let us not forget that Herbs & Rye is also a steakhouse. In the classically inspired environment with speakeasy decor, you will find your traditional, hearty butcher cuts even more savery. 
Herbs & Rye is a great place for locals to become regulars. When your friends visit to experience the Boulevard, keep this in your back pocket for a surprise, after they have exhausted themselves with our city's signature extravagance and request something unassuming, delectable, and welcoming.
Staff was on point, food was good, cocktails were terrible. I got some tropical cocktail with rum it only tasted like rum.

Happy Hour gets crowded. Legit waited 1hr30minute, however we were still honored happy hour prices.

Rib Eye + Brussels the way to go

Very good place for late dinner!! Pricy but we have a great time, we order calamary for starters was awesome!! Ryb steak was good,drinks very strong OMG , service very friendly an proffecional, i will comeback for sure

Went there with my friend, it was very busy on Wed night but we got two seats at the bar. Kenson took excellent care of us! We had the mussels that were delicious, a great flatbread, and to die for bread pudding! Also loved our cocktails! Will def be back soon!

Place is perfect every time, at the bar or at a table. Food is great for what you're paying, especially when the steaks are happy hour. Drinks are always on point, and so is the service. I come here at least twice a month. One of my favorite spots.

May be a nice spot for happy hour, but I found it only adequate as a dining experience.

My steak was nothing special, cocktails were overpriced, bartender was grumpy, and I was disappointed they don't allow smoking in the bar.  Could be a 5-Star destination if they followed Ichabod's lead and designed a dining area that has a separate smoking section, allowing grown-ups to be grown-ups.

Following a rather busy Saturday, a small contingent of us managed to get a late dinner in.  I only heard good hollers about this joint so took a detour from the Commonwealth (still never been to yet) to give them a try since the couple we was with lives deep in Hendo.

From the outside, the place looks like a dive bar or possibly even strip club or swinger bar appearance, with no windows or accents other than a well lit sign.  There is parking around the building and the place can be found on the south side of Sahara.

Upon entrance, I immediately dug the atmosphere.  Very dim lighting for those scared of the dark, lol.  It is deceivingly spacious inside and well designed in several sections for dining and the more bustling bar area.  

There was a pretty sick DJ in there spinning hits with the accompanying music videos to match.  Unfortunately, we were seated in a four person booth that was directly under on of the speaker monitors, making it extremely hard to communicate.  We resorted to sign language and drunken facial features before long.  

There is a vast menu of custom cocktails and saison beers.  Nothing extravagant, but offers a little more than your mainstream domestics and imports.  They brew their own beer as well but went with Chimay (red label) and recommended it to my buddy who is not accustomed to Trappist beer.  The ladies went with some cocktail that was a bit sour for my taste and probably explains why I didn't get its name.  

For dinner, there is two happy hours, one in the early evening and a reverse happy hour later at midnight.  All items with a star next to it are half off, considering some of the steaks range from average prices up to $160+.  My homie went with a New York steak, his lady the clam linguine, and I shared a medium rare rib eye with my girl.  Steaks are aged and grilled well.  Defiantly good cuts.  We got there about 11 and killed some time with the carpaccio, calamari and shrimp cocktail until happy hour hit.  Oh yeah the mac and cheese was on point as well.  Not nearly as good as DW Bistro though.

The decor is hip and trendy.  The bar was packed and this place seems to cater to a nice variety of heads.  A boat load of friends drove in from Cali on a whim and met over here before hitting up Spearmint Rhino for one of the girl's barfday.  It got a bit busier then and they were in the secluded section all on their own, and sadly, was not pleased with the waitresses neglect to them like some orphans with B.O.  (poor things).

The overall experience was great and can see ourselves coming by in the future, either to pre funk before a headliner venue, or just to get a late bite to eat.  The place is a hit and was highly recommended from my co dub and another couple.

Oh yeah, since the place is about rye's, don't forget to get the Sazerac...after a few, I dubbed it the commissioner sazerac (sic) instead of Sisolak...go figure.
I love it here !! Great food & amazing drinks. I love Emily. She provides great customer service & I love how she takes her time making each drink, literally to perfection !!!!

I question giving this place 5 stars because I don't want to make it impossible for us to get a reservation. . One of the most important things for me is consistency and they have showed us that time and time again.  Amazing steaks, cocktails and apps.  Happy hour is a must and luckily we live 2 miles away.  Calamari is crunchy but not chewy. Meatballs are flavorful and always order extra bread to clean the plate.  Steaks are the best in town. And a must are the donuts!!! Just try them and you will understand. Great classic place.
One of the top three cocktail bars I've ever visited. Just go, drink, and enjoy.

Nice place. A bit noisy. But the music was good. The menu was somewhat confusing. Be sure to look at the sides, those are the tapas. The button mushrooms were delicious. 

I had wanted the pork and figs but they were out. Meaning its popular.

Cozy, warm, delicious, friendly and inviting are all adjectives that can describe Herbs & Rye.  

From the warm greeting at the door, to the great appetizers and flat-bread and the old time cocktails, this place is a wonderful place to spend a few hours. 

We are not the typical guests here, since we are mid to late 50's and aren't employed in the industry here in town, but we still felt welcomed and enjoyed the cozy, comfy atmosphere that is Herbs & Rye.  There is no doubt it's more of a hipster joint, than a vintage Vegas place, but other than a DJ playing the current hits, you'd have thought you'd have entered a time warp with the old school cocktails. 

It's cool to see a fully stocked bar with a copper black splash and an Absinthe fountain.  The drinks were from another era.  Old recipes going back to the early late 1800's to the early 20th Century.  

We had the meatballs and though they were commercially prepared they were quite tasty as was the flat-bread pizza that we shared.

Overall a real hit and a nice way to share some good food, pleasant atmosphere and some old time specialties.

Apparently there are two Herbs and Rye - the one that people seem to love here on yelp, and the one I went to, which sucked.  Strangely enough, they are in the same building, so good luck getting the good one if you go there.

Everything from the ambiance to the service to the quality of the drinks was poor the night we went there.  Supposedly that is not the typical experience; so I may try it out again....

Problem 1: the bar booth tables have no leg space, so 4 of us were uncomfortable in a booth that appeared to be quite large.

Problem 2: the service was terrible.  The waiter took our drink order, and came back 15 minutes later to take a second drink order for our friends.  I inquired about where our drinks were and he then realized he never put in our drink order.  When we finally got drinks (25 minutes after ordering in a very empty bar), he spilled half of my friend's drink and one of the other drinks was only about 2/3 full.  (He did not offer to bring her a new one.)

Problem 3: The drinks did not taste very good.  They were OK, but not the awesome deliciousness that I was expecting.  Also, there are no prices on the drink menu, and there are wild rumors flying about town that drinks cost $20-30 each.  (They do not, they were all $9, which was the only reason I was not totally angry).

I've had similar cocktails at other mixology establishments that were much better... just more balanced.  These all seemed to have one taste (bitter, sweet) that overwhelmed the rest of the drink, which I think should be a more subtle combination of flavors that enhance one another, not clash for dominance.

Problem 4: The place has a lot of potential ambiance, but at some point they just cranked up the top 40 radio, which is not very "speakeasy."

The only food we ordered was the (vegan! yay!) sweet potato tots.  I really liked these, and that's why this place is getting two stars instead of one.  That and b/c the drinks were only $9.

Food is great, service is terrible and the ambiance is ok a bit dark and the music is so loud.
We had the Rib Eye with truffle fries, meat eas perfectly cooked, taste was excellent and the fries were great, dinner for two on a happy hour less than $70, it is bargain, excellent value for money

This is such a great little neighborhood joint. It is really busy after work so be prepared for the noise level and the crowds! It is a little pricey for the cocktails, I wish they would have a little more extensive happy hour list...However, their food menu items during happy hour is outstanding, totally worth a stop in. A group of 4 of us came for an early dinner, and everything was fantastic. All of the steak choices were amazing, perfectly cooked with tasty added sauces and the brussel sprouts were to dye for! We ended with the donuts...I could eat the entire plate to myself!  Overall, a cool hip little place with great food. Now if they would just include a few cocktails on happy hour (not just a glass of house wine or beer---Booo :(  we would be there a little more often

This place was recommended by a local bartender who said the restaurant has great Ambiance and wonderful food. He was right. The bad news is the parking is very small. The service is not so great. We waited an hour and 10 minutes for bread. An hour and 30 minutes 
for our food. We were seated at 8:05 and don't be fooled the manager said that he could not give us the happy hour prices as the computers and menus change over automatically. After reading some of the other reviews I know now that that is not true. The service was nothing special and you have to pay automatic gratuity. Overall the food  is spectacular but it wasn't worth the hassle.

Don't let the exterior fool you... as the saying goes "Don't judge a book by its cover"!! 

I have been to Herbs and Rye several times and have genuinely enjoyed myself each time.  

The service is always great and Gerrardo / G (the bartender) is quite knowledgeable with the cocktails and always accommodating. He alone, deserves 5 or more stars!

This is definitely NOT the place to go to for the froufrou, sweet, flower decorated drinks one commonly finds on the strip, at the hip club of the moment.

This is THE place to go to for some seriously dang good cocktails, made traditionally... just like the days during  Prohibition.  
My husband and I love that they stay true to the era and only have spirits that was available back then. It's a history lesson on alcohol!

We have never ever been disappointed with the drinks.... they are always delicious and well made. 

The food, on our very first visit, was hit or miss.
We came with a group of 10...... the group ordered the filet, mussels, several of the various flat breads and calamari.
My girlfriend and I couldn't decide on what we wanted, so G asked us what we were in the mood for and ensured it would be made. 
We asked for shrimp with linguine. (Thank you G! Excellent customer service!)
The linguine, mussels and flat breads were very good! 
In fact, we wanted more pasta. However, the steaks were over cooked and dry... and the calamari was not crisp and very chewy. 

The next time we visited, we had a group of 17 and it was a blast!
All of our drinks were fantastic and the food was delicious. No complaints from anyone we were with.
My favorite that night was the chorizo meatballs and sweet potato tater tots. YUM!! 

I recently went with a girlfriend who had never been and she was impressed.
We sat at the bar.... and of course, G took very good care of us. 
We took a chance and ordered the calamari (after all, we are human and the chef from the first night may have had an off day)
and the clams.
Both dishes were excellent! The calamari was nice and crisp, topped off with some crunchy prosciutto and a light sauce.
And the clams.... we could not get enough of it. The broth was the highlight of the dish! Perfect for dunking bread in.

I've tried many of the drinks from their cocktail list and my favorite is the Leap Year.  Cheers!!

This is an awesome little gem hidden behind the strip. Even better if you go during their happy hour between 5 & 8. Half off steaks and well drinks. The atmosphere of the restaurant is just great. They have an awesome prohibition theme menu for their cocktails which you have to try!!! I also recommend the ribeye it was delicious and cooked to perfection!!! If you are looking for a low key off the strip joint l, this is the spot!!

Clarify to the bartender that it IS Happy Hour...get him to acknowledge it! We rolled in after 12am specifically for happy hour. Looked at my phone to check time while I was STILL in a taxi...12:10..cool. We pop in and order food and drinks and have a good time. Bartender is cool...ask for the check, while he's doing stuff he says you look familiar...bla bla bla...where ya from. Finds out we're not from Vegas then shows up with a check time stamped by the register for 11:48pm as the time when we placed our order. I'm stunned that the "owner", Nicately, would pull something like this for an extra few bucks??? $22.00 dollars to be exact. I asked him about it and he said that was the time when we ordered. I told him we were in a taxi at that time...HA!! what a loser. Keep the money friend.

My boyfriend and I just ate here while we were staying on the Las Vegas strip. When we drove up...the outside of this place looked SKETCHY! Like a strip mall. Once inside, it is a very cute place. Like a dark, brooding speak easy. 

We ordered drinks, our waiter was very nice . He did warn me the Mint Julep I ordered was a very strong drink....and wow! It was too strong for me, he was very nice and offered to get me something else. 

We ordered the Kobe sliders...so juicy and flavorful! Also the carpaccio, perfection. Great meat and wonderful flavors. As well as the sweet potatoe tater tots with marshmallow crust...great idea, but fell a little short for me there wasn't enough salty contrast in the dish. We also ordered the farmers flat bread...ok, not wonderful. 

I did really like the good food we had here though. Be warned, if you like semi-sweet cocktails like me...there isn't a whole lot on the menu that doesn't involve bitters, gin, rum, or whiskey.

Would have given 0/5 stars if I could. 
I work in the hospitality industry and understand the importance of my customer/clients and have previously referred family and friend to Herbs and Rye but ad the WORST customer service experience there recently!  Waitress(and hostess) were rude and self-occupied so much so that having THREE tables(and the the restaurant was virtually empty that night)was too much for the her.  She never asked us for drinks, we ordered steak and she never even asked how we wanted it cooked...perhaps her shallow little mind could read ours?!  It was ridiculous.  We walked out and called the manager/owner who was apologetic and groveling, asking us to give them another chance, took our number promising to call back but never did.  This is a manager/owner out of touch with his customers.  Prior to this experience, we have enjoyed this restaurant numerous times, but will simply take our business elsewhere where customer service is a priority.

The food was soo good! Truffle Mac and cheese, yum! The truffle fries!, yum! Steak was well seasoned and cooked perfectly! The Brussels sprouts weren't bad, but wasn't my favorite. The donuts were good! I totally could come back to this place! Fun atmosphere and good service!

I discovered this place and decided to take my boyfriend. We love it and are hooked on their happy hour. My boyfriend isn't even a drinker....only once in a blue moon, but he can't say no to an Herbs & Rye cocktail. The service is very professional and the waiters and waitresses are attentive to your needs. Great place! Reminds me of Brooklyn. It's an escape away from Las vegas.

My boyfriend and I love H&R.  Their carpaccio is insane!  I love their classic drinks too.  We get the steak with chimichuri!  We have had the same waitress twice Xia, who is gorgeous and friendly.  We go back when we can and usually order the same things.  :-)

Not impressed.  I had heard so many good things about this spot, so when an aquantience was having a "thing" there I took time and money out of my personal accounts to join the party. What a waist. I was very disappointed. The dinning room had way to dark "mood" lighting (we could barely read the menu and everyone knows dimness vails flaws), the waitress was annoyed, snarky, the crab cakes were super fishy. I had to spit them out in the bathroom to avoid food poisoning. The mashed potatoes served with the over priced surf & turf had to be instant! Although I can't be positive about the mashed potatoes, the texture and flavor definitely tasted like it. There is no outdoor smoking area, you can't take your drinks outside (laws and all). The dinning area was claustrophobic and they wouldn't split the check (understandable, but still annoying). Overall, not the best experience. My suggestion, if you're someone who prefers quality over quantity (cheap happy hour), this is not the spot for you. Save your money. Go somewhere with more integrity. Somewhere that doesn't insult the intelligence of its patrons. Really? Instant mashed potatoes with surf & turf. Tacky.

It was nice of the bartender to let us know they had happy hour til 8 and that we just had a couple minutes to order. Then when he gets back over to take our order, we get our bill and it's not happy hour prices. They tell us, you didn't order before happy hour!? REALLY? 
Why didn't you mention that it was over before you put the order in and why did you mention it if you weren't going to be able to take our order before 8pm. Just principal at this point. If we missed it by 5 minutes due to the bartender not coming back over in time, do a manager override. Because guess what!? NOW you will not get anymore money because I am not going back! And the Filet was not up to par and was cold when it got to the table. So BYE~!

The happy hour at this place is the best in town! Everything is 50% off from 5p-8p! The atmosphere is very dark and kind of like what I would picture a vampire bar to consist of. I had the flat iron steak which was said to be 8oz but it looked much larger than that. The asparagus was cooked just right, not too soft and not too firm. The garlic mash was creamy and flavorful. I had the spicy mussels as an appetizer and they were a great way to start. I don't necessarily like gin but their gin cocktails were tart and sweet at the same time and I enjoyed them.

Without the help of yelp I probably wouldn't consider this place just by looking from the outside.  Mainly because it just looks like a bar.  Walking in looks cozy burgundy wallpaper, brick, and dim lighting. We were first asked if we are over 21 years old. We were sat at a booth alongside the bar.  Candle centerpiece.  Black napkin wrapped utensils on side plates.  Large steakhouse style menu. An old western in black and white playing on the tv. The server had pretty hair and makeup styled that went with the theme.  Merlot for me, Napa Pinot noir for him.  Although we didn't order cocktails, I appreciated the art in the bartenders craft. Working in nightlife I am so accustomed to the quick pour of drinks. This was a nice change of pace. His napkin didn't appear like it was washed thoroughly.  The server quickly replaced it. She suggested the beef carpaccio and penne.  So we chose the carpaccio over the clams we had originally picked out.  He ordered rib eye with spinach on the side.  The carpaccio came out quickly. Arugula tossed with truffle oil atop the meat, drizzled with balsamic vinegar and capers. Very fresh and delicious. Large serving but not filling when shared between the two of us. The steak!  Mmm the steak...  Ribeye. Nicely seasoned. Cooked to perfection.  Juicy and tender. I love fat, so ribeye is one of my favorite cuts.  This place did it justice. My bf of course asked for A1. It was served in a sauce cup. The spinach side was a bit small so we ordered the little neck clams. When they arrived the server spilled the sauce on the table and my boyfriends hand.  Probably because the plate was hot. She apologized but did not wipe it up and picked up some empty plates instead.  The clams were nice and small the sauce a little creamy and you can taste the herbs. The bread it came with for dipping was nice and sour, soft in the middle. My boyfriend waited a while for a refill on his wine.  Another server ended up coming by and asked if he needed another. A few moments later our server came to check up.  My bf asked for extra napkins to clean the spill from earlier and that was when she wiped it up. By then our clams were done. Shortly after his wine arrived from the other server.  Minutes after we were informed it was now happy hour.  (Clams and wine are happy hour) Unfortunately, we waited to get them minutes before happy hour started.  The desserts were offered verbally. Baked cookie topped with ice cream or sugar donuts. The photos on yelp led is to donuts. Ohh my... 10 mini donuts with donut holes.  Soft and warm with the crunch of sugar. Caramel and white chocolate for dipping. We ate every bite of our meal but 2 clams.  No to go box? Rare occasion for us. The food alone would have gotten 5 stars from me.  The bill came out to $158 before tip.  Really excited that this is a late night spot.

Herbs and Rye offers an excellent happy hour twice a day: 5pm-8pm and 12am-3am.  Happy hour gets you 50% off certain food items, $5 wells and $3 drafts.  The other evening I enjoyed a 17 oz. bone-in ribeye and a side of jalapeno creamed corn...all for a delicious $13.00.  While it still makes for a good $26 entree (ordering this dish during non-happy hours gets you two sides instead of one), getting this for half price only sweetens the deal.  This is one of the better deals I've come across in a while.  Don't get dragged to a Station Casino looking for their late night steak and eggs;  this is the place to be!

The bartenders are the other stars here at Herbs and Rye.  They have been able to make all drinks that my friends and I have ordered without giving us a blank stare and asking, "What is that?"  This is a refreshing thing to see as compared to other establishments.  My friends have been very impressed by the drinks crafted here; I think they make good drinks, but nothing on their menu has really made my palate scream for more.  I'm perfectly happy ordering an Old Fashioned here, though, which I can't say about 90% of the other bars out there!

One nice thing that's happened recently is that all the video poker machines have been removed from the bar!  This makes for an even better place to grab a few drinks and a meal if your party is small enough to sit at the bar.  Nectaly has been a superb host, remembering customers and always asking customers how their experience has been.  Herbs and Rye is another repeat eat for me here in Las Vegas!

While living in LA, I found out that I love classic cocktails and, even more so, I love the atmosphere of classic cocktail bars. Before moving back to Vegas, I did my research, read the reviews, and decided that Herbs & Rye was my new favorite bar before I even visited! Unfortunately, it's not very close to my hood, so it took a couple months for me to make it over, but here is the lowdown:

Pros
*Cool cocktail menu with lots of classic drinks.
*Fair prices during regular hours.
*Awesome prices during happy hour.
*Free drink for yelpers every time you visit.
*Cool ambiance inside.
*Friendly bartenders who genuinely wanted to make us drinks we loved.

Cons
*Location. It's really not near anything else, so it's definitely inconvenient to go out there if you aren't either a resident of the West Sahara area or staying at the Palace Station.
*Crowd. As in, there was none. Why was it completely dead on a Friday night???

Overall
I'll be back to H&R to enjoy their cocktails and happy hour (maybe even to try the food?), but it's just too far to become a regular.
Such a great place.  We loved every second of our meal.  Not to be missed.  We got there while happy hour was going on-5 to 8.  Half priced steaks.

Food was amazing!  My husband and I ordered the carpaccio and clams as appetizers and they were delicious!  The truffle Mac n cheese went well with the Brussels sprouts. We lucked out by going during happy hour; some items are half off!  I believe happy hour is 5pm-8pm.  We spent 124$ including 3 alcoholic drinks.  Cocktails were made with fresh ingredients!  All around this place is well worth the 100$ we spent and we will definitely be back!

Herbs and Rye- how do I love thee... Let me count the ways (in no particular order except for number one which is Alycia being the best):

1) Alycia is awesome! She is such a real, genuine and funny person that my husband and I make sure we always stop by when we are in town, which is often! Seriously, she is the best!!!
2) Happy hours! Early and late night deals for the awesome food here make the place a great value proposition.
3) The food!!! Where do I start!!... 
     Any of the steaks-always cooked to temperature            and super flavorful!
      The chorizo meatballs ( so good no words can describe!)
      Truffle Mac and cheese or the fries.


As a separate call out: Any of the masterfully crafted drinks! The menu is vast and full of fun facts. The best part? Tell Alicia what you like and she will pick the drink that is complementary to your preferences.

This restaurant will continue to stay in my rotation because of the food, drinks and fabulous service!

Love this Place! Great drinks - try the Moscow Mule! Its so delicious! 
Prices are very good and I went on Monday night and there was cool house music spinning in the background. Was Great.

Went here Friday night for my wifes birthday , there was 8 of us we had reservations at 7:00 . They had table ready when we got there , the service was AWESOME! ! The food was great , the cocktails were yummy! Need to go back to sample more of the cocktails . Love this place .

Interior was cool, food wasn't. Very oily and full of butter, very heavy. Couldn't breathe, and I ate only tomato soup and mushrooms, little bit of broccoli from my friend's plate. An hour later I felt very sick for two days. Drinks are very small and I didn't like the taste of it, but everyone have own taste, my friend liked it. Service wasn't the best, very slow and lady seemed like doing us a favor by serving. May be she wasn't in a mood that day or something. Won't come back.

The Only reason this play gets 2 stars are for interior design, bartenders, and their drinks.
Took them over 40 mins to seat party of 5 when there was 6 tables open, 27 mins for a glass of wine, 42 mins for 60 oz. medium rare steak that came out cold and close to rare, bringing out the steak on a cold skillet didn't help either. When they cut the steak they should know the temperature of the steak but no, they just serve it anyway. Truffle mac & cheese felt as if precooked and crumbling dry. Amount of fat on the steak was little more than 25%. I will come back for the great drinks but not for the dinner.

Amazing happy hour and cocktails! You can tell that they take their drinks seriously when the drink menu is just as long as the dinner menu. Happy hour includes anything marked on the menu with the red star at 50% off. We enjoyed the bone in pork chop and ribeye, which included a side each and were cooked to perfection.  

The cocktails were not discounted (only well drinks and house wine), but well worth the full price to get the full experience. Would definitely come back to try the other dishes!

This place has an amazing happy hour after midnight! Their steaks are half off and very good. The atmosphere is fun and great to when your on a date of with a big group of people. I didn't expect this place to be as good as it is. I was definitely impressed by the food, service and atmosphere.

The ambiance, the food, the staff! Everything about this place is amazing, from the entry into a 1920's speakeasy the moment you walk in the door to the food and drink pairings. I recommend highly for anyone who wants a unique "off the strip" Vegas experience.

This was my third time at Herbs & Rye and it is the only place I will go for steak. My favorite has been the New York Strip cooked medium. My favorite side has been the garlic mashed potatoes, but all of the sides I have tried are great. 

Don't forget dessert and grab some doughnuts! 

Make sure to join them at happy hour from 5-8 and then 12-2:30 am for some half priced steaks
Amazing cocktail drinks! I like wine, but if here - try your favorite mixed cocktail.  The gimlet I had here was delish!!
Awesome cocktail menu. Good service. OK but overpriced food. But it's definitely a great local spot. The 120 Oz steak challenge sounds fun! Good luck to all who dare to try it.

Love the craft cocktails and steaks! Happy hour after mid night is fun and half off certain food! Service can be slow so order two drinks at a time. Always busy when I'm there. Bartenders are fun and talk shop just gotta get there attention!

My review is late.  Better late then never, right?.   I had a group of 4.   We all sat at the bar and everything was AMAZING.  It was actually so good, that I can't even find it in me to bitch about the 4 dollar horse radish.   The bartender Emily, made the night.  She really has taken her job to a whole new level, she doesn't just make drinks, she's an entertainer.   If you find the time, this placed is a must.

Came here because a friend recommended their Happy Hour steaks, and to collect those Open Table points.  H&R is located next to a gas station, and I feel like it's kind of ghetto around the restaurant.

Reservation was for 6pm on Friday.  We arrived a little late because there was no parking in their small lot.  After circling the lot 2 times, we called H&R and they said the next best place to park at is Eyeglass World, 2 lots to the west.  

Upon opening the door to the restaurant, you are blasted by a wall of darkness.  We waited for the hostess to get off the phone, then she led us to our table.  BTW, the cushion seat against the wall is SOO much more comfortable than that wooden chair!  It takes your eyes about 20 mins to adjust to the darkness, but it was still very uncomfortable and disorienting to be eating with such dim lighting.  Not to mention that you can hardly see the food you're eating.

I would say the decor is a mix between pool hall meets back alley.  

Dishes tried:
- Appetizer: calamari ($17) Some server brought this out and immediately my date and I commented on the lack of sauce.  Legit, there was a drizzle of the aioli sauce, or at least from what we could see of the dish.  We ended up asking our waitress for more sauce later on and then she brings out a boatload in a gravy boat.  We could have done with that earlier...  Overall, lacking sauce and overpriced. 
- Steaks: Porterhouse and NY Strip steak.  Filet part of the porterhouse was really tasty.  NY Strip steak was on the rare side for the medium requested.  
- Sides: waitress said the truffle mac & cheese and jalepeno corn are "the best" sides.  We got those with our dishes and boy, were they horrible!  Let me first say that I am a mac & cheese and corn connoisseur, and these sides did not meet my standards.
    - Mac & cheese tasted like frozen Stouffer's.  Had that fake not real cheese taste.
    - Corn also tasted like frozen corn and towards the end of the meal, the corn texture got thicker.  Yeah, twas gross. 

Dude, if I wanted a frozen meal, I would have gone to Trader Joe's.  

BOTTOM LINE: I wouldn't even come back here for their happy hour.  Not a pleasant dining experience.

I like the cocktails, but the food is really overpriced for what it is- the only time I would go is for their happy hour, and even then it's not cheap. I had the mussels appetizer and a flatbread, other people in my party had the steaks. Both were totally fine, just not worth the high prices.

If you want a romantic spot for a fancy cocktail, this is a nice option- I won't be eating food there again though.

Herbs and Rye has been one of those Vegas staples that I've felt too bashful to step into. I thought the cocktails that they're known for would cost an arm and a leg. Their happy hour deal on steaks finally reeled me in.

I had a wonderful time with a group of five friends. The decor was cool. A lot of wood panels and low lighting. We had an awesome server. Her name was Ally I believe. She gave us recommendations on cocktails and food. She was spot on with the recommendations after we let her know which liquors we like.

My drink was delicious. I wish I could remember what it was but I don't. I know it had egg whites though. After one drink I was feeling a nice buzz. I didn't even taste the alcohol & the drink was delicious.

So during happy hour they have half off steaks that include one side. I got the New York strip with a side of truffle mac and cheese. My steak was cooked perfectly and seasoned just right. It was tender, moist, and succulent. I believe it was 16oz and came out to $18 during happy hour. 

During happy hour they also have $5 well drinks. I did opt for a rum and coke. It was a non-spiced rum and I thought the drink was delicious.

I was so scared to come in here for no reason! I found out their cocktails are all $11-$12 dollars. These are craft cocktails that's are expertly mixed. 

I just had a great time and that really tied the visit up for me. I had a great drink to start the night, an inexpensive well drink to keep it going, and finished it off with some delicious food. It was a great experience with a light price tag.

I can't wait to go back and try all of their cocktails.

I would give  this awesome  restaurant  10 stars if I could.   Happy hour 1/2 price steaks that have great  flavor.   Service  was OUTSTANDING.  It was my husband's  bday....so the owner didn't  just bring out  1 dessert. ..he brought  out 2 humongous  tasty treats.  He brought  us a "pizooki" type dessert  with chocolate  chip cookies  and 3 scoops of ice cream (certainly would  have  been plenty).  To top it off he brings a plate full of donuts topped with carmel sauce...they weren't  just good....they were decadent.  I felt terrible  not being  able to finish  them both...but we asked for a to go container....and enjoyed  them later on.   We loved this place and looking forward to bringing the kids in December.

Very good....got truffle mac and cheese and also the Caprese salad.  my friend got the sliders and the asparagus.  omnomnomnom

The drinks here are SPECTACULAR.  I tried a few but the one that stands out is some strawberry, rum, curacao and lime twist. It has over 2 oz of alcohol and is only $11.  Next time we are coming during happy hour so we can get steaks (50% off during HH).  This might be our new spot! :)

First let me start by saying the place is clean and the staff is welcoming. Several reviews mention poor waitstaff, but I found our server to be very good. The food is delicious from the steaks to the sides to the desserts. However, what I didn't expect was to pay more than 30% gratuity. The gratuity, it appears, is based on the full menu price of the items AND taxes. As a server, the government has never calculated my tips on taxes, so to pay gratuity on taxes seems a bit ridiculous. When I researched yelp to see if anyone else had commented on this, I noticed several did. Then I noticed, one guy, received a response from the owner; which was incredibly rude. I've never seen a response like that and I can't imagine someone being in business with that attitude. Want to see for yourself? Go to Herbs and Rye and in the search box place the word gratuity, then search for Bob C. Amazing! I'm secretly hoping the owner responds to my review, so I won't feel bad not returning. I considered it until I read her response. WOW!

Loved the dark, old school bar area. We made a reservation on Open Table and were running late, staff accommodates us no problem. Our waitress Debra was attentive and very helpful. Ordered half off filet, truffle mac, and sharp cheddar broccoli (my fav). Amber ale is half price between 5-8pm as well. Great meal, great atmosphere.  Owner, Mr. Mendoza, even came out to greet us at our table. Don't be discouraged by the outside, inside is charming and comfortable. Order the donuts!!!!
Excellent happy hour special... Half off excellent quality steaks .. Very dark romantic type place. Mark was excellent as my bartender server...
Great food and drink. They make a great Old Fashioned, and the filet sliders were amazing. I took away one star because they played EDM most of the night and I hate EDM.
Went here for the first time recently. The overall ambiance is neat, but very dark inside. So dark that I couldn't even read the menu. Food was good. Drinks were interesting and good too.

Awesome place! Classic cocktails, the best Gibson I have ever had! The bartenders are friendly, and all the mixers are homemade. The food is excellent and the happy hour is half off. I take all my friends from out of town here. Truly classic vegas.

Old school fun meets new school drinking. The cocktails were on point. The service was fast and friendly. The rye Manhattan was strong and well mixed. 

This place looks like a fancy speakeasy. The music isn't too loud. You can talk. 

Lots of fedoras. Everywhere.

Where to start... I love this place. The atmosphere, the cocktails, the food, the service, all top class. It is hard to find something on the menu I don't like. Some of my favorites are the meatballs, the truffle mac and cheese (w/ bacon)! and especially, the spicy mussels. All expertly prepared and absolutely delicious. With an excellent happy hour lasting from 5 to 8pm and midnight to closing, you can try selected dishes at half off. The cocktails are some of the best in town, hand crafted by one of their impressive mixologists. The Ward Eight is absolutely my favorite. The soft elegant lighting makes for a perfect romantic dinner. With their great prices,  coupled with the quality of food and service I am baffled at why this place is not packed every night. Herbs & Rye is a must for everyone.

This place was recommended to me by a local. The rib eye was great but the best part of it is this place has a happy hour from 5 - 8 and most everything on the menu is 1/2 price including all of their steaks!
The parking lot was packed with a bunch of local license plates. A good thing. Mine was one of only two cars in the entire parking lot from California.
The entire wait staff and especially Christian were very attentive.
I highly recommend the spot especially during happy hour.

We live nearby.  We always wondered why there were so many cars in the parking lot because the neighborhood is not known for foodie establishments.  Went there tonight and the mystery is solved.  Great vibe, quite with good soft music.  Good service.  Hip and classic.   Fabulous hand crafted cocktails and classic steakhouse menu with fine ingredients and imagination.

AMAZING! ....Period! 

The true highlight of Herbs & Rye is that it is the complete antithesis of what you would find on the strip.**

**Great tasting food, innovative cocktails and prompt, un-intrusive service without the stiff upper lip atmosphere. 

I was comfortable the entire time! Such an amazing experience!

This place is undoubtedly for raw unfussy foodies!

I most dig this Ol' Skool SpeakEasy type joint with a brief history lesson on prohibition era crafted cocktails.  Unfortunately, I didnt experience the wheel of a deal during happy hour, but I didn't regret even one sip paying full price!  Open up the menu and you will find a brief description on the origin or a fun fact of each cocktail.  From the Sazarac to the Moscow Mule chilled and served in its original copper mug, each one is worth giving a try.  The Bartenders take their trade seriously here which makes for a very artful show on its own!

Herbs & Rye has a great ambiance, the classic old school italian feel. Nice extensive drink list - some are very creative. Food was good, service lacked. They waited until we were finished our course, but didn't clear the plates, so we were getting plates on top of plates. I ordered my second cocktail before we got entrees and it didn't come until I was almost finished my meal! It did take a little too long for drinks that night. I'd go back to try it out again, but if I get the same service, that would be their last chance. I do have to say the desserts were really great! The doughnuts with dipping sauce and pazookie style cookie with ice cream...mmmmm!

First impressions are always important... Love the environment they've created here. Feels super rat-pack, 1920s, old Vegas style. The guy at the host stand even had a fedora on. 

We were here for dinner with friends, but got here early for a drink. We were greeted at the bar by Emily who might be the friendliest bartender I've met yet. She was super knowledgeable and offered us drink ideas based upon our favorite selections.

The menu has an incredible selection of drinks. It's very speak-easy style. So many great choices!

After the bar we moved to the restaurant. After about 20 minutes, the hostess finally came over and asked if we needed anything and said they would find us a waiter. About 10 minutes after that, we finally had a waiter. He was welcoming and pretty knowledgeable about the menu. We placed our order and the food took over an hour to prepare.

The food was really good. I had a filet minion with the herbs & rye house rub. I also had the Mac n cheese along with the jallepeno corn. My steak temp was not as warm as I'd like it to be. 

We ended up not ordering dessert. I would've considered, but was afraid I'd have to wait a long time for it. If they improved their food service, I'd give this place 5 stars.

I went here last night and felt I needed let Vegas know what they are missing by passing the place. I have so many times. But it was such a great experience there, I will certainly go again.  Everything I ordered left mr speechless. My choices for the night and suggestions are: truffled msc and cheese , long neck clams, garlicy sauted spinach, and the Kansas cut steak (med rare). My tummy was very happy!!!

Classic cocktails done RIGHT. Old recipes with a mix of flavors not available elsewhere. The bartenders know their stuff. Its worth going for the drinks alone, but you can get a good steak as well for not a lot of $. I went during "Happy Hour" 5-8pm which saw some menu items half off. The Filet Mignon was GREAT, and at half price was a good deal as well. A good drink, steak, garlic mashed potatoes and truffle mac and cheese (amazing) brought the bill to $36. Not a bad deal at all. Highly recommend.

Ive always been one of those people that use yelp but was too laZy to make an account, anyways this place is BoMb.com!!! Happy hour from 5-8 half off steaks! Got the ribeye and i give it 5/5! Went a second time and got the herbs n rye house rub, pretty nasty so i wouldn't recommend that, just get the steak by itself and you"ll be happy i guarantee it.

This is my second time here and it is definately a hidden neighborhood gem.  It's off the strip, so you'll need to drive or catch a cab there.  But let me tell you, it is worth it.  Jalepeno creamed corn was good, but would be more spectacular if they used fresh cut corn.  Bf had ice in the spicy mussels which had great flavors in the sauce, but unfortunately one mussel still had ice on it!  Get the flat iron at HH price $13, you will not be dissapointed.  It is juicy and delicious.  It's definately a bargain.  Bf got the pork and fig....omg, SOOO amazing.  Not HH deal, but worth every penny.  We had 3 rounds of cocktails each, all were unique and kept us smiling the entire night!  Will come back again next time I'm in Vegas.

Cocktail geeks rejoice - craft cocktails exist in Vegas. I'm not sure since when, but they're here in full effect at Herbs & Rye. The elixirs you'll find coming across this bar are seriously top notch and could stand their ground against any in my favorite coastal cities such as Portland, Seattle, SF and the like. I'm so glad  to have found this spot (thanks to all who recommended it and to Misti for taking me there) and it will definitely be on my itinerary for any return trip.

This is the lest "Vegas" bar in Vegas,  and that's one of the big reasons I am drawn to it. No flashy BS, no gaming, no smoking, no crazy-extreme high prices on the drinks, and almost zero pretense. Nice guys making stellar drinks in a chill, subdued setting (at least when I was in there) that's free of all the glam and glitz that exists a few blocks away. Nothing against that stuff (my stop prior to this was for a delicious cocktail at the fancy Vesper Bar) but I sure do love me good cocktails minus the snoot. 

The cocktails on the list are all classics, organized by the decade that gave birth to them. The list is medium-length but very carefully curated, and I found no less than three of my favorite elixers jumping off the pages and into my glass. The two drinks I sampled were a Vieux Carre (a personal fave) and a Remember The Maine (also a fave). Both were impeccable - perfectly balanced with a nice depth of flavor. High quality ingredients and trained hands sure do make some fine drinks. 

The story behind the guy who owns the place is a cool one too. He started out at the bottom and made is way up to the top - self taught. I respect that. And his humility and charm is something often not seen amongst the highest level of mixologists. He's a true barman. 

The food menu is hearty and tasty. I only sampled the truffled mac side fior $7 (a hearty portion) and it fit the bill. 

For a respite from overpriced drinks and chaos of the strip, get thee to Herbs & Rye. You'll make up your $$ on cab fare after only a couple of drinks and you'll be so glad you did.

If you order a well drink like bourbon on the rocks. They charge you $2 for the rocks and $5 for the well drink. When the we'll drink is $5. But if you order buffalo trace on the rocks they charge you $15 for the drink but no $2 charge for the rocks? Could someone explain this to me? (Manager from herbs and rye) I'm confused that you would charge for rocks on one drink and not the other. This place will nickel and dime you for the drinks you order there.

Amazing.
Just everything. 
Ambiance, service, food, cocktails. 
Great steaks and sides. 
Cocktails are handcrafted using fresh ingredients. 
Gets packed so I recommend making a reservation.

This is a hidden gem of Vegas.
Area is sketchy, but venue is pristine.
Early 1900s music and feel, herbs and rye had the best ambiance with its dark mood setting that's intimate, yet social. 
Ordered pork and fig and fillet mignon with truffle Mac and broccoli and sharp cheddar. 
No regrets at all. 
Dessert offerings were limited to a root beer float, cookie and ice cream, and fresh donuts. I skipped dessert. 

I would go here and recommend it anytime to anyone looking for great value and high quality, without the tourist trap prices of the strip.

Love love love this place. First class service and menu without any of the pretentiousness. Bartender, Adam, was awesome. Best cocktails I've had plus he truly cared about the patrons, charging cell phones, calling cabs etc. I'd definitely recommend this place.

I think this would be a great restaurant/bar if it didn't have so many staff problems. 4 bartenders behind the bar couldn't take care of 15 people sitting at the bar because they were too busy trying to get laid.

 Food is great here but it's strip prices basically, which is a huge problem in my opinion for a place that is trying to gather a locals following. 

Drink menu is brilliant, but it's a shame I haven't seen this place get their act together yet. Yes the reviews are glowing in 2010, but I'm 2012 it's a different story. I've given this place about 4 chances now.

Gothic/vamp inspired theme. I had the filet mignion with garlic mashed potatoes and a few cocktails. My hot date had the ribeye steak with the mushrooms which were uhmazing! And I don't even like mushrooms. Lulz. As far as the cocktails go I had the diabla which was a tequila cocktail and a jack rose which was whiskey based. Both were very strong and tasty but I preferred the Jack rose. Enjoy! it was a great steak place!

Awesome handmade cocktails.  Our servers - Christian and Ronnie - were really awesome to speak with and were extremely knowledgeable.  They recommended some great drinks based on the type of alcohol I enjoy, and the balance of flavor I was looking for.  The appetizers were phenomenal (we had the meatballs and muscles) and then enjoyed the salmon and new strip for our entrees.  We then topped it all off with their doughnut dessert with caramel and cream cheese dipping sauces - so freaking good.  Aside from the great food, the ambiance and excellent service from Christian and Ronnie really made the experience.  It has an old-school lounge feel and apparently has an awesome late night happy hour starting at midnight.  Definitely take the chance to check this place out if you're looking for some great drinks and food outside of the strip.

Regardless how you people at the HERB&RYE feel I will never ever step 
inside your establishment again ------and I have asked everyone that I know not to patronize your place of business..A very unhappy customer that would be me.....

What an amazing happy hour!!!!! I can't express enough how delicious the wings, filet sliders and spicy mussels were!!!! Everything was great as it always is, I would of given 5stars but I told the bartender twice we needed the check and still had to wait while he talked to some people. I can always say it's always a good time

This place never fails and always hits the spot. Price wise I've only been here for happy hour after midnight.  Steaks are 2 legit to quit - med rare rib inyo eye with Mac n cheese side. I have mention their drink menu is the best ive seen.  Other good mentions are the clams, root beer float, doughnuts yes dough deez nuts, and you can't go wrong with an old fashioned. Boom! You're welcome

Fantastic food. Fantastic cocktails. Fantastic bartenders. 
Looking for great steak and American food, but want to avoid the touristy Strip? Herbs and Rye is IT. And they have a robust cocktail menu and a very "craft" approach to their mixology. Bartenders are knowledgeable and friendly- not snooty hipsters. 
And half off steaks and chops on Happy Hour (til 8!) great locals spot. 

Found a new favorite spot for Vegas. Thanks, Herbs and Rye!

The perfect Vegas feel. The food was  spot on, the drinks were intriguing and perfectly balanced (also set back to the 1920s, and they're known for their Moscow mule), and the elegant lighting had me gazing at everyone's beauty. 

Happy hour is as legit as it comes. They do it so right I almost felt like I was getting away with something. 5-8pm with so many of my first picks as options including steak!
They have the option of putting a spicy rub on your steak of choice. I was hoping for mine to have a good kick but it was modest. The flavor was on point, however. 
We came for a birthday (party of 6) and everyone at the table shared family style so we could all taste the different flavors and get a good taste of the place. You just can't go wrong here and I say that after trying half the menu. 
It was busy and the parking isn't thuper. It took way too long to get our drinks and to place our order. We were in good company, however, and nobody came hangry so it actually allowed for more time to enjoy the atmosphere.

Parking is horrendous. We had to park in the alley 3 buildings west. Then once inside, we sat down and immediately started to sweat. It was as hot as a sauna inside this place. It was hotter inside than it was outside. Not only was the temperature uncomfortable, but our waiter was rude. However, The food was very good and the beer and wine list are very nice. Once our meal was done, we sat waiting for 30 minutes with no check. Once we finally asked for the check, it took another 30 minutes for our waiter to bring it to the table. I will not be coming back.

We came here on a recommendation from a bartender at another venue when I asked her where some of the best mixology in town could be found. We came here for the drinks but were wowed by the filet mignon! It was the best steak I have ever had in my life. We will definitely be back during happy hour when everything is half off. Kudos to our waitress for letting us know. Great vibe and drinks were excellent as well.

Herbs and Rye has yet to disappoint me! The drinks are always amazing and hit the spot. The food is also great, I love the calamari. Shoutout to Mark! We've gotten him as a server twice and he's always given us amazing recommendations for drinks. We don't even look at the menu anymore, just tell him what we like and he'll give you something you love.

First impression: ambiance was lovely. Cocktails: Jack Rose (recommended by server) was way too strong. Got a Moscow mule instead and it was good. Food: my flat iron steak was overlooked but still very tasty. My boyfriends ribeye was under seasoned. Garlic mashed potatoes were very dry and didn't taste like garlic. Also, onion soup was not that great. Very little cheese, very little flavor. Overall I will give it another chance but we were very disappointed after hearing so many great things.
Don't be fooled by the questionable building! This place is a gem. Great ribeye! The owner in super nice.

I've been to this place 4 times now. Wasn't ever a disappointment until this visit. I know the service is typically slow but it was ungodly slow on this recent visit. Steaks were mediocre & chewy & dry instead of the normal moist & melts in your mouth. Waiter kept trying to up sell everything even after we told him we were fine. Took forever to get drinks. Sides that we ordered w/ our meals were meh as well. Asparagus had no flavor, jalapeno creamed corn was cold, cheddar broccoli was gross - was like cheese whiz melted on broccoli. Since 2 of us share a steak we opted to add another additional side of sweet potato tator tots - seriously $7 for those things? Not worth it. Mind you we didn't add the (for more $$) marshmallow crap on top (it's gross anyway) but no plain sweet potato tator tots are worth $7. The best sweet potato tator tots I've had in this town were @ BB Kings which is unfortunately closed. I will give a proper shout out for the little neck clams. They were great in the garlic white wine broth. Got extra bread to soak up all the great juice (btw - had to has 2 times to get the bread finally the bus boy was the one that brought it to us) Bill was $249 (before tip) for 5 people @ happy hour time & 2 of us even split a steak. There are no drink specials on their "specialty" cocktails. They are $10 apiece but says that nowhere in the menu & waiter doesn't mention the price. They need to hire more waitstaff to take care of patrons as everything took forever like I said I waited there before & it's never taken as long as it did on this visit. I noticed that other tables were getting frustrated as well. Was overall disappointed  with this visit to Herbs & Rye. I used to tout this place to everyone but I will be rethinking it now.

I LOVE this place, suggest it to all my friends and come here at LEAST once a month.. I always have mark as my bartender and he is AMAZING!!  I just recently met JOJO and he comes off kinda rude.  He keeps slamming the bar with his hand, telling people to finish their drinks and asking guys if they need straws in their drinks... It just seems like he wants attention... And giving the fact that this bar has class and sticks to classic feel/drinks... He tends to give off a not so classy feel

How have I not written a review for Herbs & Rye sooner?! 
I've been here roughly around 35 times in the last few years. Great quality steaks, fun and romantic atmosphere (depending on what you're going for), and an extensive cocktail menu.  Also a huge local spot so it's very likely you'll run into someone, especially if you work in the industry.

Oh, and 50% off the steaks during Happy Hour (5-8 pm and midnight- closing) what's not to love?!


I've tried the majority of their menu and my favorites are: 

Filet mignon (all the steaks are delicious. Pick whichever cut you prefer, high quality meat you'd find on the strip without ridiculous prices) 

*the chimmichuri sauce is soooo good! I also like the house rub but beware- it's very spicy.

Sweet potato tots- You just have to try these. So so good. 

Truffle Mac & Cheese- Yes. Just yes. 

Jalapeño creamed corn- I tend to get this less often, but sooo yummy. 

Truffle fries- Simple truffle fries, but they always hit the spot.

All the sides are a generous portion, and each steak comes with one included in the price. Also, the flatbreads are all great. My favorites are the Bistecca and Bruschetta. 

For drinks, I recommend the Moscow Mule and Weekend at the Waldorf!

All in all, I love this place (that's why I keep coming back). The only thing I would improve is the service can be spotty, sometimes amazing service and sometimes it's very so-so.

I have been wanting to come here for a long time, since I always pass by it. Me and the boyfriend had a Friday night all to ourselves and decided to have dinner here. Happy Hour is from 5pm - 8pm. Which is great! 

Steaks on their menu are half off and so are a few of their cocktails. Well drinks are $5. Can't go wrong with those deals. 

We started with the Flatbread Bruschetta, which was to die for. Never had a better Bruschetta.! It was so good. The bread was perfectly cooked. Boyfriend had the New York Strip (Medium Rare) which was half off also added the Herbs and Rye House Rub which is slightly spicy and gives your steak that perfect flavor. His side was the Jalapeno Creamed Corn which was delicious as well with the perfect punch of heat. I ordered the Bone In Pork Chop (Medium Well) and paired it with the Truffle Mac & Cheese. Pork Chop was perfectly cooked. Nice big chunk of pork on my plate. The truffle Mac & Cheese was oh so delicious melt in your mouth. 

The atmosphere is dark and intimate, from the outside it looks like a small space. Walking in there they had 2 sides of dining rooms. and a big bar area. I would definitely recommend this place. And next time I will order dessert.

I've heard of this place a few times and ended up going with a group of 8 on a Monday evening. We were the only ones in the main dining room with maybe 6 people in the bar area. The atmosphere was pretty cool, but ruined by painfully slow service, and servers who had poor fine dining etiquette. We all ordered steak and most ordered a simple side of mac & cheese or mashed potatoes and I really started getting nervous as the time passed... A half an hour later our food came out in 3 separate groups with at least 5 minutes between each one. I ordered a medium rare flat iron steak and my food came out last. As soon as the server set down my plate I immediately cut all the way through the center and.......hockey puck....well done with not a drop of juice.... I was practically insulted... After a quiet "sorry about that", and once everyone was done with their food I received a replacement steak that was delicious and cooked to medium rare, however it did not make up for the fact that I had waited forever just to have everyone in my group ready to leave watching me eat my steak. We received 2 desserts to share between 8 people, I guess this was their way of trying to make up for a horrible night.... 

Due to the reviews I may give this place one more try if I happen to be in the area, but only during happy hour because the prices do not justify the service and experience provided. Most likely I will not be going back and I would not recommend it to anyone else...
Amazing food!!!! Love the steak! Go during happy hour!!!!! You won't be disappointed! Amazing cocktails!!! Def will be back! :-)

I will begin by saying I am bias. I will continue by saying my dining experience was fruitful, I didn't despise this place nor do I now. But the touted "three-star" Herbs & Rye has received is solely based on what happened after the restaurant. Maybe I'm just as bitter as the beer I received, not a complaint, or maybe I'm just indifferent cause I have had world class bistec in my time, not a complaint. 

I came here on a weekday, I believe it was a Thursday. To get it started, we went during Happy Hour. Happy Hour is from 5-8pm and 12am to some un-Godly hour. It includes the choice steaks, well drinks and beer and some appetizers and such. A fair deal for steaks you usually overpay for in most cases. I came here with a bunch of friends for a nice relaxing, cheaper than usual meal.

I won't complain about much, the service was great and I wasn't misled on any of the items. Usually when you go to a place, the server will try and sway you from the Happy Hour deal for their own benefit. Not here, our waiter pretty much made it seem like we were crazy to choose any of the full priced items. I ordered a Red Amber beer because it was Happy Hour and when I got it, it was a little warm. He did tell me they were changing the keg, but I assumed that it would still be cool. Not in this case, I still drank the darn thing because I have problems, but it wasn't as refreshing as I probably expected. 

Speaking on my behalf, I ordered the "Bone in Kansas City Strip," which I added a spice to the steak (it started with a Ch- kind of deal, I can't recall - but it was olive oil, garlic and thyme I want to say). You also get a free side and I splurged and got the truffle mac n' cheese. Overall  the meal was delicious and I was super full after eating. I wish that you didn't have to pay 3 bucks to put the topping on the steak, but I mean when you're paying half price for $30-40 steak it's worth it. My steak did have bone in, but it was oddly peculiar that there was bone also lining the rim of portions of my steak. A tedious process to cut around, but again, steak is steak and a man likes to work and earn his food. 

Okay, so I left and proceeded to have a horrible night. I spent more time with the toilet then I did with my girlfriend that night, our date night. My stomach did not feel good and I was miserable after. Maybe it's the mess that is my body or maybe it's the food I ate, but I didn't enjoy the feeling. I haven't ever had food poisoning and I don't think I even had it at all, but the feeling after the meal I had wasn't normal. That being said, it may be a little bit till I go back because I may have to get bowel reconstruction (a joke -__- ). I don't blame on it on the place, but I just have to say I didn't feel like that until after the food. So, I applaud the efforts of the Herbs and Rye staff and I will be back. But when my bowel is ready for another round. Otherwise, people should come here for some decently priced food and drinks!

My coworkers and I made plans to visit Herbs and Rye after work to partake in their reverse happy hour. I was extremely excited and pleased upon entering. The decor is downright cool. The bar looks like a lab conducting experiments! My coworkers were at the bar waiting for them to get our table ready. Once it was ready we took our seats. We weren't given any menus so we just sat there a while. As soon as our server finally came over to fill waters we asked for menus. A majority of the 10 people at our table ordered off of their hand crafted cocktail list. It seemed to take FOREVER for our drinks and our server didn't use the time to take appetizer or dinner orders to help....now our entire table was full of servers from a steakhouse so we remained calm and understood what was up. I was 5th to order and I went with a medium rare ribeye and my side was the Mac n cheese. We ordered the calamari and little neck clams for our apps. And we all ordered different sides to have variety to share. So the clams came out and they were AMAZING! I could dip bread in that sauce for the rest of my life!! After a while our food starts coming out....calamari showed with dinner. So they brought out the first 4 people's food first then the next tray had the other 5 people's food.....where's my food? Everyone was eating and our server never came back to check on us so I couldn't tell her anything!!! I didn't want to make a scene but finally 15 minutes later she comes with my food. No I know this is a small restaurant so maybe they didn't have enough room to cook my steak. But I had ordered in the middle and she never came to let us know it's on its way or anything. And worse off 5/8 steaks ordered were over done. Our sides were AMAZING and the calamari was different and GREAT. But our steaks were sad :( and my Mac was gritty and didn't taste very good, no one at it....so we had asked about dessert before we had ordered food and because of the pics on here I knew I wanted those doughnuts!!!!!! So we ordered 2 doughnuts and 2 cookie things. She came back and said no doughnuts whaatataaaaaat you just told us there were doughnuts!!!! So we get our cookies and they are obviously burned. To the point if I had been serving it I wouldn't have let it touch the table. 

Will I return? Probably! For doughnuts and for clams and brussel sprouts. Not for steaks or to sit at a table. We'll stick to the bar.

Quite possibly one of my new favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. I came here with two friends on a weekday evening for dinner. 

My only complaint was that the lights kept changing for some reason from normal dining atmosphere dimness to really really dark and it was kind of distracting. At one point we even joked and were wondering if we were about to witness a performance. Also parking was kind of annoying and I had to park in a sketchy ally quite a ways down from the building, but it wasn't the end of the world. 

I had a moscow mule to drink and it was AMAZING. It is one of my staple drinks and they served it with a ball of very finely crushed ice inside of a copper mug which made it more of a slushee moscow mule, but either way it was amazing.

For dinner I had the pork and figs and it was also amazing. Perfectly cooked and a VERY thick cut of meat. It was served over potatoes.

The service was also really good, and best of all was the happy hour pricing which made what could have easily of been a very expensive dinner, a pretty reasonable one. I cannot wait to go back soon!

When traveling, I always like to try and find one of the local places off the main drag. A friend of mine who lives in Vegas met me for dinner while on a trip. We headed away from the strip to Herbs & Rye.. a place that my friend had heard of and wanted to visit.

Pulling up, I had to tell myself that outside appearances are often deceiving. We parked outside the rather plain building and walked into a beautiful restaurant. After my eyes adjusted to the super low light level, I saw exposed brick walls accented with deep shades of red splashed throughout the place.

We made a reservation on OpenTable and were seated immediately after checking in with the hostess. She gave us a choice of sitting at a table in the bar area, or a seat in the main dining room. We chose to sit in the dining room so we could chat. With only 6 or so tables, it was perfect to carry on a conversation.

I was really looking forward to a drink after reading the reviews on Yelp and seeing the photos other reviewers had added. A killer headache kept me to water only, but I definitely had drink envy when the party next to me started getting drinks. The menu was smaller than I expected.
