The steaks are amazing, the sides are the best mac and cheese and mashed potatoes I've ever had. The fact they even have happy hour and half off steaks and certain cocktails is so awesome. And also the cocktails. Well all the bartenders there are true bartenders making amazing cocktails from all periods of time. They also just got rated best cocktail lounge in Las Vegas. Emily is an amazing bartender with skills and personality. I truly love this restaurant. Always best to call ahead and reserve a table if you have a few heads with you. They will always try to accommodate. Everyone there is smiling and enjoying having customers there right down to the bus boys. Thanks Herbs and Rye for being awesome. See you next week!!!

Their sides are absolutely delicious (minus the truffle fries)! 

Great happy hour deal, 50% off steaks, where can you get a better deal! Drinks were very interesting, loved the ambiance! Server was great .. especially right after I was at Capo's .. made the service here seem even better, they actually knew of my existence. 

Next time I must try the dessert, I was too full to try it this trip. :(

Went a year ago everything was great. Today  Valentine's day I figured what a great place for me and my husband to go...It was nothing like our last experience. Service was terrible, steak was under cooked, bus boy topped off my perrier with tap water. I will never go back or recommend this place to anyone!!!

Herbs & Rye was some of the best dining I've had in awhile. The aesthetic was incredibly cool, with a jazzy vintage theme, the service was awesome, the food was delicious, and the drinks - which are the main event at Herbs & Rye - definitely lived up to the hype. 

The parking lot is small but there are plenty of empty spaces in the businesses to the west, and just looking at the exterior, you would have no idea how classy (but not fussy - some people were dressed to the nines in the bar area but plenty were wearing jeans and flip flops) the place is on the inside. 

Happy Hour is from 5 (I think?) until 8, and most foods and basic mixer drinks are half off. That was an incredible deal and certainly one that will have me coming back to the restaurant. Their specialty drinks - which consume 3 whole pages in the menu, compared to the 2 pages of food choices - are really what H&R is known for, and for a good reason: they're unique in their flavor and strong in a way that drinks no longer are in Vegas these days. Arranged according to the historic era in which they were popularized, it is difficult to choose which one to order, as they are all so interesting. While they aren't included in the Happy Hour, they really hit the mark: for $11, I found myself pretty drunk after half a glass of my cocktail (admittedly, I am a bit of a lightweight, but still - it's a great value). 

For drinks, I chose the Weekend at the Waldorf - a very sweet and fruity concoction that our waitress described as "like drinking a pez candy" - and I have to agree with her. I loved it. My friend got the Fogcutter, which was served icy cold in a fun ceramic tiki mug, and while it was a blend of liquors I'm not really into, she loved hers, too. For food, she got (and loved) the flatbread, which, as an app, wasn't included in the Happy Hour pricing. For $4 more, I got the NY strip steak with garlic mashed potatoes. The steak was very well seasoned and the mashed potatoes were creamy and flavorful. 

This will probably be my new go-to date night venue. I highly recommend it.

Very good place. Good service, and outstanding food. I do not eat meat, and always get the sides. Jalapeño cream corn, garlicky mashed potatoes and spinach is all I need. Great place to get together with friends. Great happy hour prices, including 1/2 off steaks for you meat eaters. Parking is hard to get sometimes.

Emily created cocktails that thrilled the entire group. I usually ask for a whiskey cocktail with Cynar that's not bitter to test the ability of the bartender and she ROCKED it! Then she made me a. Bourbon cocktail with a Mexican Fernet that was outstanding! The rib-eyes from the in-house butcher shop were delicious and my friend raved about his lobster tail. The only downside was the limited wine list (I love a good red with a great steak) and our server was inattentive - but the manager bought our last round and saved the day!

Great Streak. I had the NY Strip and it was perfect. Quality cocktails, and the sides were excellent as well (wife loved the mac 'n cheese, I liked the Brussels Sprouts). My wife had the chicken and risotto, which she shared and we both thought were great as well.  Truly, the steaks here are what are remarkable though.  Happy Hour pricing makes them even better.  We'll be back...and this should be a part of the rotation...which is remarkable because it's nearly halfway across town from where we live in the southwest.

Dined in the other night & it was overall a great night. Advice: make reservations, overheard that it was a 2 hour wait on a Friday night. Anyways, Made reservations the night before who happened to be our server. He mentioned our party should arrive before happy hour ends, which none of us knew about! So that saved us 1/2 off. Service was amazing as well, had some minor bumps that he immediately took care of w/o being hesitant. I wouldn't recommend the mash potatoes but the truffle Mac & chz are to die for. All the steaks were great! Overall, service 5 star & food 4 star. I'll definitely be back though.

If you find yourself near the corner of Sahara and Valley View be sure to give this gem a try. Old school handcrafted cocktails with proper spirits and natural ingredients will lighten your mood and the food will nourish your soul. During happy hour all steaks are half price (which makes them reasonable). The 24oz porter house will melt in your mouth ($30 during happy hour). I also highly recommend adding the bacon and blue cheese crust for another $6.50. How do you make meat better? Duh, add more meat! This isn't just bacon, it's 2 quarter inch thick slabs of amazing covered in melted blue cheese! For dessert how about a skillet of fresh baked chocolate chip cookies covered in ice cream? Yeah, I thought so. 4 cocktails, 2 entrees, a side and dessert came to $90. That's a bargain for how good everything was. Highly recommend this place!

Made a reservation for 4 and got seated on time, but the experience went downhill from there. My party and I came here specifically for their happy hour..50% off steaks! However, about 45 minutes later...we finally received our food. It took more time for the food to arrive than for us to finish. Yes, the steak was pretty good, but I'm not sure if I would be willing to return to wait an eternity. 

Also, I completely understand that the waiter has no control over how fast the food will come out, but it would have been nice if we were offered more bread in between or gave us an update on what's going on. When it came to paying, our server split the checks into two for us (for two couples). We got our receipt back and signed for the credit card, but he never gave my friend that paid in cash his change..um..did he assume that was his tip or something?? Unprofessional. We didn't bother to ask about this as we were already here for way too long. My friend obviously didn't leave a tip cause he just kept the money..

On the bright side..they are on top of refilling your water. Keep in mind I drank a lot of water when I was waiting for 45 minutes. Yep, there was always a full cup of water.

While we got off to a bad start, at least it ended with good food. 

We arrived at 6:55 on a Friday night with no reservations. They said it would be a 30 minute wait (no problem) and we weren't seated until 8:30... That's an HOUR longer than the estimated wait time given without even a free drink offer as compensation. Needless to say, by the time my butt hit the chair, I was a grumpy girl!!!

The tomato soup was outstanding and it comes with a tiny grilled cheese sandwich on the side. Everyone else enjoyed their salads and the main dishes were presented beautifully, had lots of flavor and our bellies were full and happy.

It's become a hit or miss.... When they're busy, the food quality lacks.  Happy Hour of 1/2 off many entrées is a great value when the food is good, but a waste of money when it's not. If you have a few drinks, which I usually do, they make up their money so the quality of food should always be consistent.

As a vegan, loving a place known for their steaks and Mac and cheese sounds kinda hypocritical. However, this place offers an eclectic cocktail menu, amazing veggie sides, and delicious flat breads for those of us who aren't so crazy about meats and cheeses. 

The ambiance... Think brick floors... Red velvet walls... Low lighting and antique chandeliers... Old music from 20s, 30s, and 40s playing with black and white movies on the TVs. I almost felt like I was stepping back in time into a hip and super secret speak easy... 

The service was great. We were seated promptly and our waters were never empty. She checked on the table just enough for us to never need anything... But also not feel overwhelmed. 

My last experience here was a tad bit underwhelming due to their portion sizes of their sides going down. *thumbs down* However, everything tastes pretty amazing and they were super accommodating to my vegan needs. I ordered the button mushrooms and garlic spinach... Yum! Seasoned to utter perfection and cooked just right... It's definitely a vegan crowd pleaser. My boyfriend and dad ordered huge steaks that came with  sides. My mom ordered a flat bread and a side of mushrooms... Everyone loved their food. They offer half off steaks and certain cocktails for happy hour. I got a great glass of Cabernet for only 8 bucks! :) 

    They are open late and offer two happy hours... 5-8pm and 12am-close. The parking can be a little tricky but there are plenty of open lots near by:) I'll definitely be returning.
Truffle mac n chz is a must have! Great specialty cocktails and great happy hour 5-8 12am-3am

Unfortunately I heard how great this place was, but never got to experience it. There was a buyout at the time. I probably would have waited, but the hostess was such a BI@TCH I wouldn't stay. I will also never be back.
Great food. Great staff. Amazing decor! Definitely worth a visit.

The outside of this place does not give it any justice. From the outside the establishment looks like a cheap bar. However, the inside is totally different. The atmosphere is like a bar on the 60's like Sinatra times. The lighting is very dark, as a matter of fact too dark to even read the menu. Their drink menu is pretty cool, they have a large variety of unique drinks which illustrate a specific period of time. Some of the time representations were the Prohibition, Gothic , Golden age, etc.  Their speciality is their steaks. During happy hour (every day from 5-8) the steaks and the appetizers are 50% off. We ordered the Kansas City bone-in  which is a good choice if you like the grilled taste. I got the Filet Mignon which was juicy and very tender. The sides were very mediocre. They were something that I could probably do at home with no problem (and I'm not a good cook). We ordered the mac n cheese and the jalapeño corn, and they were equally disappointing. I saw a lot of small plates that look really good, perhaps I would come back and try them instead of the steak. Oh as an FYI, we read on the menu that you cannot share your steak if you buy it during happy hour! Even though we never planned on sharing, it annoys me when an establishment tells you what to do after you are paying for your food!

Ordered a filet with the egg and bacon. Asked for the egg white to be fully cooked. Got my steak, was missing bacon and the egg white was still runny. My husband was also missing the bacon. They took our steaks in the back, threw some bacon on the plate and cut the white stuff off the egg!  Manager did not seem to care. Thought I found a good steak place close to home but guess not. I'd rather go to Mortons and spend 100 more.

Great classic cocktails done by great BARTENDERS not mixologists.  The food is phenomenal as well.  My lady cannot get enough of the carpaccio that is covered in arugula.  The flat breads are very good as well and the butcher portion of the menu...whoa.  Definitely a local gem and worth checking out. We go several times a month.
I don't drink so I can't comment about the drinks. But my friend said his cocktail was not up to par for the price. Food was good. Service is excellent

As a local, i try to stay away from the strip and go to different places as often as i can. Wow, this place is fantastic! Love their late night happy hour! We went there a little earlier, so we didn't get to try the happy hour, but for two drinks it was about 20$. I think thats reasonable. The docor is awesome too! 50s style, exposed brick, music in the background and the bartenders are wearing black and white. This place is very similar to Commonwealth (a bar downtown) and i will definetelly be back over and over again

We went there twice on our last trip.

The first time we were part of a group of 6. We got there about an hour and fifteen mins before happy hour ended and we got seated about 20 mins before happy hour ended. There happy hour is good because some of the steaks and a few other things on their menu are half off! While we waited we found an area to hangout around the bar. i personally don't like cocktails, but for people who do they enjoyed the cocktails there. There's no prices for cocktails marked on the menu, but they generally range $11-13. 

Our main table was nice. The restaurant didn't seem crowded or loud and our table was spacious. The restaurant decor is nice. I think our server was inexperienced (or just a bad server). One of the people at our table ordered a bottle of wine and the bartender had said they would make sure it got to our table. We asked the server about it a number of times and he seemed to have an issue asking the right questions and being able to get the wine. Overall he was pretty awkward. Three of us ordered pastas and he failed to bring over the complimentary bread until we asked. The issues with the services were annoying, but they weren't a huge deal. The part that definitely made it worse was that since we were in a group of 6 they automatically added the tip onto our bill- and it was on the non happy hour price. I wouldn't mind tipping that amount if the service were good.  But, the service we got did not come close to warranting the size of tip the server got.

The second time we went the service was great. The server was knowledgable. The guy that was helping clear tables and refill waters was exceptional. A water glass wasn't empty for more than 30 seconds before he had it refilled. 

As for the food: My boyfriend had a steak and has said it was good, but nothing special. The mashed potatoes he had as a side were ok, but portion was small for the price. Our friends had sides or mac and cheese and that also was small. I had the linguine and clams pasta. It was good but lacked flavour. The main reason I would order it again is that it is on the happy hour menu so it ends up being reasonably prices compared to a lot of other things and since I'm not a steak eater its a good alternative. The spicy muscles were great!! I would definitely try them. I enjoy hot food, and they were spicy but not too spicy. It came with bread which was good for dipping in the spicy tomato sauce. We ordered the pappardelle. It was our mistake because we assumed there was a meat sauce with it. Was rich and had an overpowering garlic taste. Make sure you save room for the donuts. They are plain sugar donuts with two dipping sauces!

I think the broken sign and nondescript door all play into the prohibition theme of this restaurant....   A coworker told me about the happy hour here that runs from 5-8pm and 12am-3am....HALF OFF STEAKS! WHAT?!  Now that is my kind of happy hour! The 18oz boneless ribeye was $24 and comes with a side.  The ribeye was cooked perfectly and marbled well with fat.  We tried a few sides since we were with some friends.  Honestly, the sides were underwhelming (jalapeno creamed corn, sweet potato tots, brussel sprouts).  I definitely would not pay the regular price for the sides again.  A few of the appetizers were half price, so we tried the spicy mussels ($13).  The marinara sauce that these mussels come with is addicting, we kept asking for more bread to sop up all the sauce.  The bread is warm, freshly toasted baguette and perfect for soaking up all the garlicky goodness.    Honestly, the price of most of their happy hour items is what I would probably expect to pay normally.  The items on their food menu seem grossly overpriced for this location, so unless you are here for happy hour....I say there are better options.  I highly recommend if you want a good steak and don't want to pay a visit to your cheap steakhouses like Outback, then to come give Herbs and Rye a try.  Also make sure to sit in the bar area, the regular dining area seemed dead.

Italian? This is more a steakhouse than anything else. Its also definitely $$$ vs the $$ that it shows on Yelp (maybe even 4$). 

++ happy hour (4pm to 6pm, and midnight to 3am) makes it well worth it. steaks are half off.

++ quality: truffle mac & cheese was rich & fantastic. flat iron steak was juicy and flavorful. 

+ cost: split a Caeser salad, and the two of us were out the door for $55 total.. stuffed and fully satisfied.

service was very friendly, albeit it a bit slow. but I didn't mind, we were seated in a table by the bar and it has a nice atmosphere.

Okay so it's been a long azz time since I wrote a review.  This place made such an impression on me that I just had to get back on here and share.  Damn it's been over a year!

This place has that old school speakeasy vibe that I've been looking for (don't let the outside of this joint fool you)..... 

-dark lighting to set the mysterious and chill vibe right. CHECK

-simple, classic styled furniture and decor as if you walked right back into the past.  CHECK

-leather booth seating.  CHECK

-small, quaint, and not a manufactured corporate chain.  CHECK

-friendly service that knows their menu inside and out.  CHECK

-damn simply,  a classic, cocktail lounge with character!

There's two sides to this joint, the restaurant side and the bar side.  Pick the side based on your purpose for being there.  Duh, I was here to drink....so straight to the bar I went.  The bar is the perfect place to chat it up with the bartender and ask questions about the drink menu if it's your first time here.  Mike (our bartender for the night) was very friendly and explained the menu very well.  School was in session.  Great service overall.

I cannot speak for the food since I came here purposely to drink and chill.  But from what I saw and smelled everything looked great.  Some random girl next to me ordered the donuts.  They looked so damn good I was gonna chat her up and see if she was willing to share!  She was a cutie, but it was the donuts I really wanted.  Hahaha.

Anyway, back to the real reason for this review....the DRINKS!  I cannot explain well enough how awesome these drinks were.  These drinks are handcrafted, classic drinks representing different eras of American drinking.  

Wait, did I tell you they were handcrafted?  Yes, handcrafted!  Hold up.....let me change that....these weren't just any drinks...these were cocktails.  And the cocktails weren't just poured....these were handcrafted.   Dammit......these were Handcrafted Cocktails!  No pre-made mixers or store bought juices used at all.  Cocktails shaken by hand over one shoulder.  Fresh cut fruits for the juice or zest only.  And a little bit of fire for the Blood and Sand cocktail.  Watch out now!  Very entertaining to watch these bartenders make your drink.

I listed below the eras the different cocktail menu items represented:

Gothic Age of American Drinking (?-1865)

Golden Age of American Drinking (1865-1900)

Old School Age of American Bartending (1900-1919)
.
Prohibition(1920-1933)

Years of Reform (1934-1948)

Dark Age of American Drinking(1949-1989)

The Revival of the American Drinking(1990-Present)

Side Story:
I came here on a recommendation a couple of bartenders (Kevyn and Jonas) from the Social House (yes I was drinking there earlier that day too) made to me when I had asked if they knew of any place in Vegas that was a chill, low key place that was unique.  They had asked in return if I was looking for something on the Strip or off the Strip.  I mentioned that I've done the stereotypical Vegas scene plenty of times already.  They told me specifically to check out Herbs and Rye.  And I'm glad I did!

My buddy and I tried a few drinks that were recommended to us by the bartenders from Social House:  Aviation, Blood and Sand, and Vieux Carre.  

When my buddy asked what was another good cocktail from the menu, Mike our bartender of course replied "everything", and then continued to handcraft a cocktail called Corpse Reviver No. 2 for him.

Man, they were all good!  Next time, I'd probably start with the Vieux Carre for the full, bold taste and end with the Corpse Reviver No. 2 which is more sweet and refreshing.  The Aviation and the Blood and Sand were somewhere in between.    I highly recommend all these cocktails.


SIde Notes:

-We came here for late night happy hour 12AM-3AM and only spent $9 a cocktail.  There's no way on the Strip we would've gotten strong quality handcrafted cocktails like these for $9 each!   Tell me if you do.

-It was Late Friday Night/Early Saturday Morning when we rolled in and they were spinning old school Hip Hop!

-It wasn't packed in here at this time and the clientele seemed more like locals then tourists. 


Okay yeah I get it, people come out to Vegas from all over to party up on the Strip....  dress up all fancy, throw cash around like you're dirt rich, drink expensive drinks, etc.  After awhile isn't always the same?  If you wanna check out something different check out Herbs and Rye.  At the very least start your partying here for the earlier happy hour...then head out to the Strip.  If you're already partying on the Strip, you'd probably wouldn't physically be able to make out here for the late happy hour (yeah I know you party hard).  In case you do, it's the perfect place to unwind and chill for a couple more cocktails before going to bed. 

So what if  I left this place about 3:30AM and feeling really good and ready to continue partying....don't judge me!  

Definitely coming back when I'm in town

[EDIT WIP]

Have you ever cried deeply into your food because the first bite alone just made you feel like hot butter rolling down fresh warm grilled corn?

It's nice to know there's a really good steak house open till 3 a.m. . You would think vegas  is filled  with restaurants open all night  but that's not the case  especially great one's. My husband and I came here for Valentine's Day because we had to work late and we had the best time. The food was really good we got a giant steak and had a lot to take home. I love the drink menu, drinks were excellent. The ambiance was fun yet it could be romantic too especially when you're with the right person. It's dark and the music is loud enough. We will definitely be going back

Love this every time we are in town m. Super nice servers.  Happy hour steaks are the best deal in town.  The broccoli side is my favorite.  Spinich is just ok to me.  I can't get enough of this place!

We were looking to have a drink and some appetizers off the strip before seeing a show. I found this spot on yelp and figured I'd give it a whirl. We got both the clams and mussels which were half off during happy hour (from 5-8pm every night!) as well as a variety of different cocktails. The mussels were spicy and soaked in a delicious garlic sauce, that was so delicious, that we asked for extra bread so that we could sop it all up. The clams were drastically different in a creamy butter sauce, but equally delicious!

The cocktail menu is a work of art and a history lesson all in one. Along with the ingredients of each drink, the menu also details how the drink was originally created, and when. With so many choices, we had some difficulty choosing, but the waiter was ready with the recommendations, and he chose a perfect drink for each of our tastes.

This is my favorite place to come with family and friends. Anytime I want to impress someone, I always bring them here. I usually start off with a Manhattan or Old Fashion cocktail, then a Tomato Bisque. When I'm there for happy hour I'll go with the Filet topped with a wine glaze and a side of garlic mash or Mac n cheese. All the bartenders are the coolest. Mark is the most engaged in conversation, with me at least. Emily and Adam know how to liven the place up though. Ali is my favorite server.

I went here during their late happy hour, which is from midnight until 3AM (50% steaks and select items. Anything with 2 stars next to it). I had high hopes for this place based on 2 friends who have gone during happy hour for the steak and I was not let down at all from the moment the 'Littleneck Clams' hit my tongue. My date and I also ordered the 'Spicy Mussels' which were also delicious, since both of these seafood appetizers were on happy hour. I did not choose a drink from the amazing time period cocktail list. I was looking for a certain taste for my cocktail choice and the waiter suggested a fine cocktail not on the list and I absolutely loved it! We ordered two '14oz New York Steak Strips', one with 'Peruvian Chimichurri' and one with 'grilled onions'. If you ordered one steak to split, they will charge you $7. For our sides, we got 'Garlicky Spinach' and 'Truffle Mac & Cheese'. EVERYTHING was cooked perfect and every bite had me weak in the knees and melting on the table. We were so distracted by our food that we barely touched our drinks until we were done eating. We were so full that we didn't try their dessert. You don't have to sit at the bar to enjoy their happy hour menu. I like the dim lighting and the way the restaurant/bar is set-up. The service was great and quick. There were maybe 25-30 other guests there around midnight. We will definitely be back!
This is a strong steakhouse.  1/2 price steaks and wine if you come early.  Fantastic drink menu and really cool staff and music.  Enjoyed a nice NY strip and side with my wife.

Went for happy hour. Half off several menu items including filet mignon dinners! Drink specials weren't too good: $5 well drinks and buy one get one 1/2 off bottles of wine. I would like to see a discount on the classic cocktails to encourage people to try your specialty! I had a clover club and blood and sand classic cocktails. Both were good but the blood and sand was better! Steaks were cooked to perfection and the flat bread pizzas were huge! Great visual atmosphere but the music was off putting - you can't play house techno music in a fine cocktail lounge... service was fine once I mentioned I was a yelper.

Our expectations might have been too high due to so many 5 star reviews, promising online menu, glorious pictures that yelpers posted....But it was just average for us.  Their drinks were good but we didn't feel they were unique or exceptional.  We ordered Vieux, Jack Rose and Ward Eight which were all recommendations from our server.  The food (ordered Ribeye, NY strip, mac & cheese, and garlic mash) was average, but I didn't hold it against them too much because it was happy hour pricing.  Overall, value-wise, it's very affordable.

Also interesting note, if you call before they open (5pm I think) you're going to be told that their number is not in service.  Now where I'm from, you get that message when your number is disconnected or you're no longer in business.  I thought this place has gone out of business until I called right at 5pm just for the hell of it, and the hostess picked up.  LOL.

This is definitely one of Las Vegas's hidden treasures.  A friend of mine met me here for dinner.  At first glance, you're like whoa. Doesn't look like much from outside. Then you enter and.... bOOM! A huge bar and about half a dozen tables. Luckily we were there for happy hour because I really wanted to get a steak ( but didn't want to pay the high price). There's a huge steak there for 180$. If you eat it in 20 minutes, it's free. 
I had a rib eye with some mashed potatoes. 
yUMMY. 
The drinks are amazing. The menu has like 4-6 pages and only 2 pages were food. I got a $14  "painkiller". The only way to describe it is - desert in your mouth. 
WOW. Yummy. 
Will definitely return with a bunch of friends.

Half off happy hour steaks, that's where it's at.  The items on the menu with 2 star icons denote the items that are half off during happy hour =)  The sides, are a bit, pricey for how small they were.  The steak is just a good hunk of meat, it's probably choice but whatever they cook that baby in departs a great flavor =d  I'd skip the mac and cheese and stick with the smashed potatoes.

ps...skip the restroom, I hear it's haunted @_@

This place has been on our radar for a while now but we finally got around to checking it out when some friends suggested it for dinner.

We arrived a little early so we made our way to the end of the bar where we were lucky enough to grab two seats.  I started to run through their extensive list of cocktails and it took me a few seconds to realize how neato their menu was, broken down by eras.  It was sort of educational but fun, cuz it was booze. 

Because I'm a fan of egg white drinks, I went with the Pisco Sour (also a fan of this drink anyway). And this was a doozy.  It was the fluffiest drink ever and the best Pisco Sour I've ever had the pleasure of throwing back.  I think the bartender's name was Joe.  He employed a multi-step shaking process and definitely got the volume other bartenders covet.

Our friends showed up and we made our way to the entry area to greet them.  Unfortunately, the only damper on the evening was how long it took them to seat us since we had reservations and the table (as well as other tables) had vacant and ready to go since we started waiting.  Maybe they were trying to scrounge up a server?  I dunno.

Food was impressive on the whole.  To start, we the calamari which was deep fried but then tossed with some sweet and hot peppers.  Yum!

For the main event, I ordered the filet mignon while hubby got the double cut pork chop.  Hubby thought the pork chop was decent, though a little overcooked.  My filet mignon was a perfect "rare" as requested.  Yum!  We shared a few sides including the jalapeno cream corn (delicious), garlicky spinach (really garlicky but not my cup o'tea due to a sweetness you don't usually get in this dish), and truffle mac & cheese (must order).

During dinner, I had a couple more drinks - the Hemingway Daiquiri (good and not at all like the pink slushy stuff you think of when you hear "daiquiri") then went back to the Pisco Sour.  Unfortunately, this next Pisco Sour wasn't as fantastic as the first one.  Oh well!

Service was pretty attentive.  Our friends happened to be familiar with our guy (though I don't fault him for pretending to remember them) because he used to be the bartender.  He was very friendly, helpful and attentive.

Definitely going to be a place for us to come back to, especially for the drinks!

Great sides, but be sure to order one temp up on your cut. My med rare fillet was mooing at me.
Atmosphere & cocktails A++++

This establishment looks very appealing.. Ambience is nice, but their business would probably benefit by putting the correct closing weekday hours on their website. My boyfriend and I drove all the way from mountains edge to catch their late happy hour (12-3a) but unfortunately we arrived to find out that last call is at 145am, not 3.

Officially my favorite place to relax and have a few drinks. They have a unique variety of drinks to choose from, all of which, at least of those I have tried so far, are very delicious. The food exceeded my expectations as well and I fell in love with the half-dollar sized clams. To top it off they play a great selection of music to keeps you there for hours!

Great food, good drinks and really cool environment. Reason for the 1 star was the horrible horrible wait staff. Everything he could have done wrong as a waiter he did & paved the way with apologies.. Don't say sorry, just be better at your job. Otherwise, I enjoyed the king Kong and a variety of cocktails. I may go back, but never on a Thursday at midnight again
The steak here is ridiculously good, if you're going to come here I recommend during happy hour from 5-8pm. Half price steaks, c'mon!
Came here to grab dinner with a friend. Fantastic steaks and great drinks selection. The outside didn't look like much but the inside decorations had a cool vibe.

Best bar staff in town! Emily Yett is absolutely fantastic, best customer service I've seen. So engaging with guests and really an expert in her craft. Emily, you made my night, even though my date sucked. On top of that, you make impeccable cocktails and are just super cute! :) everyone was just so entertaining and nice, I don't have enough good things to say.

After volunteering at the Wine Walk at Town Square for 4 hours, it was already close to 10:30pm and BFF Mel C. and I still needed to eat some food, even though it was way past my bedtime.  We picked Herbs & Rye on the fly and it was a nice choice, especially since they stay open late.

I had:
tomato bisque with grilled cheese 
side of truffle mac n cheese
some of the calamari that Mel ordered

First of all, it's dark in there.  I had a hard time reading my menu.  They play really good music.  The service is great and our food came out fast.  Maybe because I couldn't see that well in the dark or because I was sleepy, I didn't realize my soup came with a grilled cheese sandwich.  I probably wouldn't have ordered the mac n cheese side, but then again, I love mac n cheese and theirs was flavorful. I enjoyed everything I had except the calamari.  There was too much going on there with some assorted toppings and I'm not even sure what they were:  green peppers, green onions, some kind of mayo dressing?  I had to dig towards the bottom of the bowl to get to some of the calamari that was untouched by all that stuff.  
Overall, it was a great meal and I enjoyed the ambiance of the place.  We'll have to go back to try one of the alcoholic concoctions on the menu that looked great and when I'm more awake.

Ok it's been a while since I've posted but I think I'm ready... (cracking knuckles) here we go. 

AM and I needed find a place for diner before going to the Sting concert. Both of us heard good things about Herbs and Rye so I called an hour before and they had room, excellent.

Arrived and exterior looks like a classy bar. Walked in and was seated promptly. Looking at the menu, they didn't have the Mushroom Panzerotti that that was on the website menu. No problem, ordered the Linguine & Clams. The clams were really good as they were still in the shell so really fresh. I really liked the flavor of the clam juice with the wine, garlic and chili. Only thing that was disappointing was the pasta was overcooked. I like my pasta soft but it was like baby food. Didn't order dessert as we were on our way to a show. 

I would come back for drinks but not for dinner.

Update to my original review. Talked with manager, asked me to email him the details and bank print out to show him the draft was indeed too much. He managed to take my only record of the transaction from my girlfriend during her discussion with him then claimed that he did not take when whe asked for it back. No correspondence from the the email and no answer to phone calls. Dinner ultimately cost $320 for some basic food that way ovet priced with bad service. I'd stay away they seem to be ok with being shady business.

Place is as good as it gets
Everything we have eaten there is awesome and even more incredible half priced during happy hr
The drink menu is so well crafted and delivered by knowledgeable and personable bartenders,
decor is great
I wanted to take my gf's sister and her boyfriend with us here on happy hr but we got caught up on the strip with them exploring,we missed happy hour still brought them,i footed the bill and still didnt mind paying for the quality(although happy hr is and even better steal) if i had any complaint, after bartending and managing bars the one thing i always preached with my bartenders is you should appreciate every tip you get  
but if someone goes head and shoulders out of the way to take great care of you take an extra second to let them know you genuinly appreciated it...i tipped about 90 dollars on a bill just over 200 as i told him he was all set he said thank u as is appropriate for any tip but when go to cash it out and see someone tipped u that well u naturally would assume u would turn around show graitude.i mean i make it a point to shake hands with someone if they tip me 5 on a round of drinks
This place was good. Visited during happy hour. Our spicy muscles  appetizer was great. Drinks were good and the steak was even better.

This is a review of their Happy Hour.

The Skinny: overall, the food's not bad - but could use some refinement (3.5) Service: pretty good but we also hit the Happy Hour as soon as they started (3.5) Value: not bad during Happy Hour but seems rather expensive during regular hours.

We walked into Herbs and Rye and immediately felt like we were in some sort of vampiric den. No windows, not much light, my hubby and I squinted as we tried to read the menus. Not to mention being blinded every time the door was opened.

We were seated promptly being the first ones there. We ordered an arugula salad, the gnocchi and the steak with a side of truffled mac 'n cheese.

The arugula salad was okay - but nothing special. The peppery flavour of the lettuce was rather unbalanced - requiring more acidity. It really needed something sweet to even those aggressive flavours out. Perhaps beets or fruit or something.

The gnocchi was delicious albeit it was slightly overcooked (I felt it was a little on the softer side). It was light and fluffy which is really hard to find. The ragu was also quite tasty and mellow. I didn't think that the gnocchi dish was improved with the addition of bacon and could do without it.

The steak was fine- cooked properly. The side of truffled mac 'n cheese was okay but not great. The sauce was a little too runny while the cheese overwhelmed the truffle flavour a bit.

Overall, the dining experience would rate a 3. Just the gnocchi alone would get a 4. So we'll average it and call it a 3.5 star review.

Returned last night and sat at the bar during happy hour. The happy hour is top-notch as virtually everything on the menu, including some hefty entrees, is 50% off from 5pm-7pm, and then they have reverse happy hour, but darn it, I didn't notice the hours. I was being selfish. Sorry! Oh, wait, there it is right up there on the Yelp business listing: Late night 50% off 11pm-3am. This adds up quickly in a good way. My bar mate and I had five cocktails and some crispy calamari for $25. I am not even sure how that is possible, but it happened. 

I had a couple of Diablos- a tequila drink with ginger ale, cassis and lime. My friend had a Clover Club followed by two French 75s. She really liked the French 75; it is made with champagne. All of their syrups are made in house, and you can tell that they take pride in their craft. 

The vibe is VERY dark and mysterious. I am still not digging their plates, but I guess that is a minor detail I will have to get over. It is balanced out by the wallpaper. Just don't look down at your plate if you can help it.

The bartender and staff are nice characters; they can be mysterious. I think they really take their prohibition theme seriously, which I can appreciate. I didn't have a dining room experience, but I enjoyed relaxing at the bar without being smothered by smoke! I am adding a star for a smokefree evening. If you sit at the end closest to the door, you get the ins on the restaurant action, as that is where all of the servers come to retrieve their drinks. I appreciate a little behind the scenes commentary. 

Oh, and they are hosting special cocktail events on Tuesdays at 10pm. We had been there since 6:30, so we didn't stick around, but it looked like it was going to be a fun shindig. I received a rather handy Sailor Jerry dog tag necklace with a built-in bottle opener. I might check the event out next week. 

So, keep up the good behavior boys! I am giving you five stars, and that is a very big responsibility.

An off the strip (but not too far) local gem! ...You're welcome. 
I am torn about writing a review for Herbs and Rye...I kind of want to keep it off of the radar and keep this little gem all to myself. However, the experience was beyond awesome not to give a huge cheers to the: ambiance, mixologists (bartenders), and food.
Herbs and Rye is everything you want in a dark and sexy bar in a location that you don't want it in..which totally adds to its appeal and allure. (Thank the parking-lot gods, parking was easy breezy).
The ambiance is on point from the dimly lit bar and smartly dressed staff. I'm a sucker for period, artsy, glam, & gothic noir and this fits the bill. 
I sat at the bar and ordered my traditional rye-whiskey and ginger beer. However, I took plenty of time to let the drink menu school me in the ways & ages of alcohol:  Gothic, Golden, Old School, Prohibition, Rat Pack, & Revival!!! The bartenders at Herbs and Rye are mixologists and know the ways of spirits. 
Soooo, I've been around for some 30'ish years and I will go on record saying the tomato bisque soup is the best I've ever had...It's paired with an over the top delicious gourmet grilled cheese sandwich...So DON'T order the amazing yummy flat bread as a side like I did because I didn't read the menu far enough to see the grilled cheese. Ha! Beyond satiated!!!
If I didn't live in Portland Oregon this would be 'my spot'. 
I will absolutely be back the next time I visit Vegas. 
Do come hungry 
Do come thirsty
Do make a reservation for the restaurant 
Do ask the bartenders to make you a 'surprise' drink if you don't know what you want
Don't drink and drive. If you do drive parking lot is available, do have a designated driver. 
Do take a cab/uber...and believe me leaving sober isn't really on the menu 
Don't be alarmed by the co-ed bathrooms but do lock the doors, all of them.

The late night happy hour with half off steaks is awesome. our server (young latin girl) was super friendly and very nice. porterhouse was cooked perfectly. No British beers was a disappointment but it forced me to try something that was pretty good - Seef.

If you want a spot at the bar, come early. It's really the best seat in the house. You get to watch the bartenders do what they do best. Their cocktail list ranges through the eras of the history of the cocktail, so there is definitely something different and fun for everyone. I also love that they use fresh ingredients with an abundance of fruit adorning the bar. 

We came in for a quick, quality, craft cocktail and weren't disappointed. We tried the Aviation and Boulevardier. Both very well done. 

It's been a while since I've been in for food, but last I was here we had half-off steak that was excellent. Come for the full experience or just a drink. It'll be worth your while.

Love this place! The atmosphere is swanky and the staff is friendly. My boyfriend and I always come here when we are in town. Come to happy hour between 5-8pm or 12-3am for half off the littleneck clams and steak. All of the steaks I have tried are amazing. Try with one of their marinades. The signature cocktails are not part of happy hour but they are also a must try. Really cool history to go along with each cocktail and great presentation and taste. One of my favorites is the clover club.

I have to give Herbs and Rye the full five stars. The atmosphere was great and lively, from the time we walked in. Everyone, from the hostess, the servers, especially Alycia, were awesome and wanted to make sure our evening was great. The food was delicious and since it was happy hour, many of the meals were discounted. We were celebrating my wife's 65th birthday and the staff made sure it was memorable. The evening topped off by some great specialty drinks and one of their signature desserts. Thank you again to the manager Michelle and our server Alycia for ensuring we had a great evening.
My absolute favorite place to eat in Las Vegas! When someone mentions herbs & rye my mouth starts watering! Truffle mac & cheese is my favorite! Happy hour is also Ridiculously amazing !

Where do I start?  One of my favorite spots in all of Las Vegas.  This place is a hidden gem and I think a lot of people pass by it a million times and disregard it.  Here's the Low Down...

Decor:
Swanky, chic and old school.  One of my favorite "date places" or just a cool place to hang. 

The Booze:
BTG wine list is solid.

The cocktails are amazing.  These guys know their stuff and have really mastered the art of Mixology with their craft cocktails.  

Extensive list of all liquors, specifically their Gins and Whiskeys.

Solid beer list

The food:

The food as awesome.  Especially for the reverse happy hour!  My personal favorites are the Jalapeno Cream Corn, Kansas City Strip with peppercorn sauce and Prosciutto Asparagus Flatbread.   

If you haven't been yet, YOU NEED TO GO!
Great cocktails, perfectly cooked steaks and thoughtful service. What else can be expected?

I am sitting at Herbs and Rye, dumbfounded by the spectacular service. 

It is my mom's birthday today and we figured we would try this place out. I heard my friends rave about the atmosphere and the food quality so we figured, why not? 

Seating was quick although unfortunately it was in front of the bar. It would usually be okay if I were out with friends but if you're coming for an intimate night, between family or your significant other, be sure to call for a reservation and ask for a table in the backroom area. It'll surely help save your voice :P. 

Back to the amazing service, we ordered the clams appetizer as a starter. It was a decent size but probably not good to share with more than 2 people. The sauce that came with it was WOW. 

For the main course we opted to get the King Kong steak, a gargantuan steak weighing in at 60 oz (that's 3.75 lbs!!!!!) along with a delicious side of mushrooms and Truffle Mac & Cheese (MUST HAVE). 

The steak came out cold at first so we asked the waitress if we could get it warmed up for a bit. Out steak was taken away and we were promised to get our steak back nice and warm but something more impressive occurred. The manager came over to our table and told us he felt it was unacceptable that our meat was cold so he told us they were in the process of making a steak that would come fresh out the grill and straight to us. When the steak came out it was better than the first bites we first took with our other steak and we were all pleased. 

The professionalism that the manager and the waitress demonstrated was beyond our expectations. 

Will we come back? HECK YES! Any restaurant that is committed to having customers leave happy is a restaurant worth revisiting. 

Tip: Come from 5 pm to 8 pm to enjoy half priced drinks and some STEAK (amazing, right?)

I came here last night and I can't believe it was my first time! The atmosphere here is on point. I love the dark setting but not your average quiet spot. It was pretty busy and loud but it didn't seem short of anything but good vibes! I highly recommend coming here. We made a rookie mistake of not going during happy hour when a lot of entrees and drinks are HALF OFF! However, it still will be on the pricey side I suppose. Oh and we did have a snooty server. Regardless it was a great dinner. The presentation of the food was very nice and my favorite was the red wine glaze that came with the filet mignon! It was delicious. Im even considering having my birthday dinner here! It seems perfect for a big group of friends to start or perhaps end the night with! 

The first two pages of there menu are food items and the rest of it is a really extensive drink menu. I shared the surf and turf with a side of cream of corn (MY FAVORITE) and mac n cheese! Highly recommend them to you all.

Finally we got to experience this place not happy hour time the regular priced time we had four martinis three tasted exactly the same the beef tartare was pretty good the bread was old and really tough the calamari had a great touch which was some peppers in it but without the peppers it would've been just soggy and greasy so we r  going to give it a 2 1/2 three-stars...next time we're going to try to happy hour hopefully the experience will be a lot better

Yes!!! it was super easy to make reservations for 7 online. We were promptly seated when we arrived and our server was awesome.  

The happy hour is great!  Yes, the steaks are 50% off and the steaks are yummy.  My filet had more of a char than I'd prefer, but it was still yummy.  Bonus... each steak comes with a side!  I got the truffle mac and cheese!  It was really rich. 

Love the variety of drinks that they have. We will definitely be back when we visit Vegas.

WHO: If you love italian, you'll love this place for sures! The bartender & server were super sweethearts & also chatted it up with me!

WHEN: The first time I hit this restaurant up, I missed Happy Hour by a minute! Literally! So, from my experience, you definitely need to check it out from 5-8pm, and 12-3am! Happy Hour consists of half off the entire menu! =D Also, if you are a yelper and you let them know, you are rewarded with a free cocktail with the order of an entree. Yayy for yelpp!!

(I went there recently and there are cones directly in front of the restaurant due to construction! I automatically thought it was closed because there were no cars in the parking lot, but my friend and I took a chance. MISSION COMPLETE!)

WHERE: Located on the corner of Sahara & Arville, look out for the red sign!

WHAT: There were no cocktails for me this time, but I will look into it on my next visit! After a couple of hours of shopping, my friend and I decided we wanted to try this place out. (I really just wanted to see what the Truffle Mac&Cheese was all about, haha). 

My friend and I tried:

-Italian Sausage Flatbread: I was seriously expecting something small, but the server came out with an 8-piece flatbread pizza! It was marvelous! The sausage gave it the taste it needed, and I LOVE FLATBREAD!

-Truffle Mac&Cheese: Ahhh!! Thank heaven for mac&cheese!! I am a lover of macaroni & cheese and this has got to be one of the best I've ever had!! I am craving for some more just thinking about it! There is such a perfect amount of truffle in every single bite, and the perfect amount of cheese. It is just pure perfection!

-Pork & Figs: One word that describes this dish... BOMB!! I've never tried figs (besides fig newtons, haha) but they were just dandy! I wish I would have taken a picture of the dish (as I usually do!) It was perfectly created, the pork on top of the gravy'd mashed potatoes, and the flavorful figs all around it. I highly recommend!! =D

WHY: The food is a must & an A-plusplusplus, the service was incredible (newfound friends), and the atmosphere was just CHILL!

*NOTE: REMEMBER TO GO DURING HAPPY HOUR!

A diamond in the rough.  Not the greatest location in town, but OMG the food and choice of cocktails are out of this world. It's like stepping back into the 20s or 30s when you get there.  The cocktail choices are eye watering.  Then there is the food. We had several item from the menu but I feel the  Caccuccio was the star of the show.  I reminded me of the some of the better restaurants  I have eaten in when in Europe.  I will be back.

This is a good solid steakhouse and apparently a local favorite. Came here with a group of friends on a Tuesday night for a friend's birthday. Parking is a little tricky cause the lot is small and people just make up their own spots along the wall. Some of my friends had to park in a different lot so that kinda sucked. When you walk in the restaurant has the typical steak house atmosphere... Red walls, chandeliers and dark lighting. 

They have an extensive menu with a great bar and eclectic food choices. The double stars on the menu means that it's half off!  How awesome. This includes the steaks, pork chops and some appetizers. When is happy hour? Not really sure but we ordered around 7 to 730 which is prime time for dinner and we got happy hour prices. There were multiple waiters to fill our water cups, get drink orders and serve us basket after basket of bread.  Bread is delicious btw. It's warm and comes with whipped butter. 

We had the spicy mussels to share for appetizers. It was delicious. Reminds me of boiling crab but less oily!  We ate all the bread and used it to soak up the yummy garlicky sauce. For half off it was a great deal. 

I ordered the ribeye medium rare and my side were Brussels sprouts. The steak was pretty big! It was really charred and crispy on the outside but on the inside it was a perfect medium rare.  The steak was sooo good!!  Juicy, salty, great texture with a slightly crispy outside. My first bite was heaven. The Brussels sprouts were super good too. It was very oily because it had thick cuts of bacon in it. I love Brussels sprouts and it's actually my favorite vegetable so these were great. I also got to try the truffle Mac and cheese and creamed corn. All were really good!  Can't really go wrong. 

After our meal we got a digestif. It was like a thick minty herbal syrup. Tasted a little liked chinese. medicine. Not for me but some people like it. 

My 18oz delicious juicy steak was 30 bucks. Definitely will come back!!

In the search for the perfect cocktail bar to drink at and have a snack - Herbs and Rye came up in every list. I had to try it for myself and I'll be damned if it wasn't every bit as good as advertised.

During the first few minutes at the bar I asked the bartender if they could make a particular drink I'm recently obsessed with as I've had a few tell me no (some bars won't as its very high cost with a large portion of it being bitters). He was a little bit condescending in his reply saying they aren't "some bar" and I'll be honest that this put a sour taste in my mouth at the beginning of the meal. I now had a chip on my shoulder. I wanted to dislike this bartender. But, to the best of my ability, I couldn't do it. He was way too damn good at his job.

We ended up having about five rounds of drinks, two of which were the bartender's choice. All of them were variations or choices from their menu (generational / historical drinks). All of them were poured well, mixed well, and delicious. The only one thing was different to what I'm used to was that the aviation I ordered was faaaar more tart than I've had before. I'm assuming this is an ingredient ratio difference, no big, it was still good. Our last two rounds of drinks were creations of his own, the last being made with a tasty black strap molasses. Lesson learned: let the bartender pick your drinks here.

Food. Oh, the food.

Did I mention their happy hour has half price steaks? As in 50% off. Whaaaaaat. So good. I got the flat iron medium rare with chimichurri on the side and a side order of bacon+brussels. Everything was delicious. The cook on the steak was maybe 5-10% under what I'm used to but I enjoy it however - this didn't detract from it at all. The chimichurri was flavorful and zesty. The Brussels sprouts were crispy and delicious.

Between my friend and I we ordered 8 drinks, had two shots, two steaks, and two side dishes. We walked out of there for less than $170 total (including tip!). I was very pleased. 

Eat here!

Good drinks, amazing drink menu! They've got pages of drinks from different eras in cocktail culture with all the staples, Scofflaw, Ramos Gin Fizz, Corpse Reviver #2, etc etc. We are getting fairly well versed in cocktail culture and found a few I haven't tried and a few on my "to drink list." Went late for after dinner drinks, but their menu looks promising, they claim to butcher their steaks on site, and as impressed as I am with the drink menu I plan to return with friends for some steaks. Will update review after we try the food!
Great food. Great service.  Ask for the bartenders special, you will not regret it. Great drinks. Amazing mixology here.

Great late night spot for dining as well as handcrafted cocktails. During our most recent visit we were well taken care of by Mike who gave us great service. Food was tasty & drinks were on point! Calamari is a definite favorite there as well as the caprese salad. They also carried one of our favorite wines by the bottle, Meiomi! Shoutout to Mike who sent us out an Anniversary dessert on the house! Overall we had a great time & will definitely be back in the near future.

Meh. I've experienced better -sums it up. 

Very small and intimate place. Low lighting reminds me of the Griffin downtown, LV. Came for a bday dinner. Our waiter was Eddie. He was friendly but couldve been more attentive. We needed more water and menus as the party arrived. Happy hour wasn't great. The 2 star items on the menu that was half off was very limited and expensive to begin w/. Tried some cocktails bizz neez(?) resembles a lemonade and the other more popular grapefruit-like cocktail. Nice and light, kinda like a crystal lite. Ordered the skirt steak well-done & truffle mac &cheese w/ bacon side. It was a little over cooked bc it was tough to cut and very dry. I know I ordered well-done, but I've had well done steak and it should not be that dry. The truffle mac and cheese is slightly under cooked. Took it home and the next day it was sitting in a pool of oil (: yumm!! 

I enjoyed the company &the atmosphere but there are better places in Vegas. Thanks but no thanks.

As a bar I give them 5 stars for their unique, fun blast from the past twist on American history of alcohol and night life. But the restaurant side of the house is mediocre.  The food lacks flavor but are all ok and great for safe eaters. The server we had was spending more time talking to me like I was his dog then trying to provide good service. Leave the swearing for home, not work.

First impression of showing up at Herbs and Rye were not the greatest. 

From trying to find a parking place to walking into a dark, dark restaurant and having to wait for the hostess to return to the stand and not be greeted right away or even looked at. Almost some what completely ignored for several minutes while she was playing with some menus, looking at the computer and whatever else. 
But after we were seated our server was awesome and helpful, he explained the specials and since we were there during happy hour the steaks were 1/2 off and they came with 1 side. So, the steaks weren't horrible just way too chard on the outside and incredibly pink on the inside. 3 of the steaks were ordered medium well, however they were more like chard medium. However, The pork chop with figs was incredible. 
As for the sides, the mac n cheese, truffle fries and broccoli and cheese were all really good. 
For dessert, the donuts were good,  however, the Crème brûlée wasn't good at all. It wasn't creamy and the topping was too thick. 
Also, the menu says that for parties over 6, gratuity is included. However, it is calculated on the regular price menu, not the happy hour menu. Kind of suspect, especially since happy hours are 5-8 and midnight to 3am. I think that is kind of wrong and our waiter didn't tell us that the gratuity was included as well. 
In conclusion, I'm not so sure that we will be back, especially with so many exceptional restaurants in town with easy parking, amazing customer service, ambience, and great food for the "happy hour pricing" which in other restaurants would be normal pricing.
Love the cocktails . Happy hour is one of the best when it comes to the food . Bomb steak and I love the ruffle fries . The atmosphere is great.

I'm not one for writing reviews on Yelp as I think the majority of yelpers aren't qualified to be writing reviews and for the most part are full of self importance. This is my first (and hopefully only) post on this terrible app. Only doing it as I've read too many reviews from people with sh#t for brains.

1) Don't take stars off venues because they only have a small parking lot. Parking is a privilege not a right. Bars/restaurants/lounges pay rent on the entirety of the land the venue occupies, including the parking lot. They are not generating revenue from parking, so just be happy that any parking is provided. Walking 10 minutes isn't going to hurt you, tubby.

2) Don't take stars off a steak house/cocktail lounge for having no beers on tap. If you want tap beer perhaps you should be at a pub. If you feel the need to drink beer at a cocktail lounge drink bottled beer; if you can't afford bottled beer what the hell are you doing at a cocktail lounge?

3) Don't take stars off a restaurant because there's nothing you really felt like eating on the menu. Seriously...you went there Einstein. If I was craving sushi, I wouldn't go to an Italian restaurant, then complain about the lack of sushi.

4) Don't complain about waiting 10 mins to be served at a cocktail lounge. Life is not about instant gratification. If you want your order taken and a drink in front of you within 2 mins of setting foot at the bar, then go to a dive bar. If you want a cocktail that is made with pride and care, be prepared to wait. Cocktail lounges and dive bars are not the same thing. Would you go to Gordon Ramsey's gourmet burger restaurant and expect to have your food in front of you within 5 mins of being seated? No, you'd go to McDonald's.

5) Don't start your review with the  words "I'm a vegan"
No-one cares.

6) Don't spend 30 mins in a venue and give a 3 star review, then state it's because you didn't have enough time to give them an appropriate evaluation. Why the fudge are you reviewing them in the first place? Full of self importance and hurting a business' livelihood just to indulge your e-peen.

7) Don't deduct a star because you walked in at 7pm without a reservation and had to wait 30mins for a table. Whose fault is it you're disorganized and think you're special? The restaurant? News flash, you're not special. You're waxed mustache and ironic t-shirt are almost identical to the guy sitting at table 3.

8) Why on God's green earth would you deduct a star because the venue is "too busy"!?!? Punish the venue for being good at what they do and attracting business...that's the spirit.

Seriously...1st world problems for people who apparently have a 1st world education. Petty complaints for people looking for reasons to be unhappy. Enjoy life; we're here for a good time not a long time, so make the most of it.

Herbs and Rye is a great place; the food is superb and the cocktails are even better. Staff are awesome if you don't go out of your way to be a jerk. Go in with the right attitude and you'll have a great time.

OMG I am in love. I have been wanting to try this place for a while and I finally got to go on Friday. We went for their first happy hour of the night from 5-8pm to take advantage of the half off steak special. They also have a second happy hour from 12-3am for those who like a late night snack after drinks at the bar. We decided to split the King Kong Ribeye between four people.

Before we sat down for dinner we went to the bar. There I discovered the massive drink menu and had the hardest time deciding on a drink. I need to go back multiple times because there are so many I want to try! What is so cool is that they have drinks by time periods. You can order a drink from originated from the 1800s or 1900s. Under each drink they have a mini description of how this drink came about. I thought that was so interesting and neat. The drink I got at the bar was the French 75. It intrigued me that it had champagne. It was very tasty and I enjoyed it. We also ordered the calamari at the bar which also did not disappoint. I loved all the banana hot peppers they had in it.

When we were seated I then ordered the Bee Knees. Best decision of the night. It was gin, lemon and honey. So delicious and not too sweet. I need to learn how to make this at home. As I said before we decided to get the King Kong Ribeye cooked medium. It also comes with a complimentary side which I thought was awesome. We decided on the mac and cheese. We then ordered the Brussel sprouts and asparagus. The meal was great. The steak was good just the right amount and was very tender. We had more than enough and was able to to take it home and eat it for lunch the following day. All of the sides were a perfect size and they were all eaten by the end of the meal.

We were too full for dessert but those doughnuts sounded awesome! 

If you are looking for a steak house in Vegas you must try Herbs and Rye.

I had several friends recommend this place. I made reservations for a Saturday night at 5pm. I found out they have happy hour until 8pm and included a few appetizers and proteins. We were blown away by the food. Truly amazing place to have steak and a few drinks. We ordered the bistecca flatbread, ribeye steak with red pepper sauce, New York strip with mushrooms and onions, whiskey scallop potatoes and sprouts and swine. It was delicious. Plus you order your steak according to their scale and they will cook to perfection. Great place for locals or if your traveling to Las Vegas and want to try something off the strip. Very easy to find. Make sure to get there early or make a reservation. By the time we left there was a line out the door!

I liked the sweet Thai sauce it was so yummy it should come served over a bed of rice I was temped to start licking the plate!  I ordered a filet with Mac and cheese and my bf got the ny with mashed potatoes..  I preferred my filet over the ny but they were both very good and cooked perfectly!   My mac n cheese was actually kind of gross!  I did not care for it at all Kraft out of the box has satisfied me better!!  The mashed potatoes were very tasty!! I can't wait to come back!!

Update.  Went on or just around Halloween.  Good times.  And they were open.

Well this is about the third time I've been here and they've "closed early". Thx for making me drive out here to get my drink on then close. Shiftys is awesome...  You guys are amateur...

This was a fun experience. The food was pretty awesome. The late night happy hour is a great deal for my carnivore husband. Not so much for his herbivore wife. But still a great time. The server was good, not great. We got told it would be a 25 minute wait, but it was definitely less time than that, however a group that came in after us got seated before us. So they lose a star for that.

The environment is very nice, in an old fashioned kind of way. It was pretty wild for a Tuesday night which I thought was odd.

The three ladies had a whiskey and ginger ale, the bartender was very friendly and I enjoyed his helpfulness. He was quick, friendly, checked up on us while we waited for our table and overall gave great customer service. Later in the evening I ordered an aviation. If you haven't had one before try it, it takes a bit to get used to but it was delicious none the less. Will definitely be back again!

If you come to this place and order from the bar always order from mark! Everyone else doesn't come close.  Mark makes the best drinks.  My GF made the mistake of ordering from someone else .  Big mistake on her part!!!!

Awesome atmosphere, classic gourmet drinks, great staff! Nectaly's shareable steak was amazing! I can proudly say it is best steak we ever had. Great happy hour specials. Coming from NYC the atmosphere made me feel like home. Came here twice, once on a date with the hubby & celebrated his birthday with family and friends. The husband previously came here for a birthday party with his LeRêve performer friends and could not wait to take me here. We enjoyed our time and will definitely recommend this place to everyone looking for a chill spot with delicious food. Despite what others in our party had said in their tacky Yelp review (party of 2 which the step father was spiteful & using his wives account to place a negative review due to his personal issues), EVERYONE enjoyed themselves including the birthday boy, our pescatarian family, out of state family and friends. Nectaly is amazing and we will definitely return with friends. Keep up the good work guys!

Yelp had this place categorized incorrectly as Italian and tapas. It's definitely not either. ITS AN EXPENSIVE STEAK HOUSE. Had the 18$ calamari and it wasn't even close to worth 18$. I was seated by the bar and it was VERY loud. They moved me no problem though. The waiter was great. The beef tartar was great but my friend @Annemarie H. Got the squirt stinkies almost immediately.  Oh yeah and the toilet had mold in it.

This place has very little parking, its noisy and dark, its small. The Caesar salad is nothing special and the calamari was chewy. With all that, this place is awesome hahah. The steak was incredible and if you don't get the bacon on it you are a fool. It is the most delicious bacon I've ever had. The sides are nice as well. The beat is that if you eat there before 8 you get half off your steak. This only adds to the enjoyment. This place is fun, crowded, and has phenomenal steak. Just be prepared to park in a shady alley.

I loved the atmosphere from the moment I walked in. The menu is unique and also a great conversation starter with its timeline styled cocktail menu. I had the years of reform cocktail to start along with the mussels. They both were amazing. I was sold on those two things alone . For my entrée I had the prime rib garlicky spinach and  truffle Mac.  Last but not least for dessert I got the crème brûlée which was delicious brûlée but someone was a little heavy handed with the blow torch.  I will definitely be returning and cannot wait to try what else they have to offer.

We made reservations the morning of on their website and received an email confirmation no later than 2-3 hours later. We originally had reservations for 7:00PM on a Monday night to try and make it for their happy hour deal. Unfortunately we were running a little behind schedule so I called around 6:00PM that Monday to see if we could push our reservations back. I got the machine but left a message to see if we can change our reservations to 7:30PM. Michelle kindly called back within 30 minutes and let me know that it'll be no problem to come in at 7:30PM.

We arrived and were told it'd take a moment to set up our table but we could hang out in the bar area. They have an extensive cocktail menu that was a bit overwhelming to read. My boyfriend and I ordered drinks, he got the zombie and I got the blinker. The moscow mule and pisco sour caught my eye, but the blinker was actually pretty strong so I felt like I couldn't(shouldn't) order a second drink. I was constantly looking at my cellphone for the time and at the host to see if he knew where we were (or remembered what we looked like) to be able to tell us when our table was ready. After about 20 minutes we were invited to our table. We settled our drink bill at the bar and got seated.

After we put in our order, our server was nice enough to tell us that we were able to make it in time for happy hour (with only 4 minutes to spare before it was 8pm), so we got a few dishes at happy hour price - which is a really good deal for the quality of the food.

We ordered the beef carpaccio to start, then shared the linguine and clams and the 18 ounce ribeye cooked medium. The linguine and clams and the ribeye were at happy hour prices (which is 50% off). The linguine and clams was delicious, the white wine sauce was perfectly balanced. It was thin in consistency and not over garlic-y. The dish came with a piece of bread which we both used to soak up extra sauce. The ribeye was good, I usually prefer ribeye over because the rich flavor it has to the cut. Our piece was cooked perfectly and was more than enough to share - we found ourselves pushing our limits on the last few bites because it was so good we couldn't stop. The cut was a bit fatty (as ribeyes usually are) but I personally like the charred fatty bites. 

We had planned to go to dinner as a celebratory event and stated that in the reservation but didn't think much of it. Our server seemed dodgy when we were trying to get his attention, but turned out he eventually told us he was stalling for time because they were cooking up some complimentary donuts for us! What a sweet gesture. My boyfriend isn't really a sweets person (he NEVERRRRRRR eats dessert when we go out for dinner) but he could not resist the fresh donuts drizzled in caramel sauce. It was so good. We had a good experience. If you're looking to go, I'd definitely recommend going during happy hour and making a reservation!

It pains me to give the delicious food here such a low rating, but there are two reasons for it.

1. The prices. Without the Happy Hour, the prices here are ridiculous. You can go to Ruth's Chris Steakhouse for these prices and get a far superior cut of meat for the same prices, if not less.

2. The service. Oye. We were a party of 7. Normally, I'm very forgiving of mistakes in a big party. Things are just bound to go wrong when you have that many people to serve. That wasn't the problem here. The problem was that we were in the restaurant for almost 2 hours and saw our waiter 4 times. Maybe 5. He came and took our orders, then he disappeared. 35 minutes later, we haven't received any of our food, and we haven't seen our waiter in 35 minutes. Several of us wanted to order another round of drinks and were stuck trying to waive someone down. No one ever came. Finally, he came with our food and we quickly ordered drinks while we had him. He disappeared again until he came around with our check.

The worst part is, the restaurant wasn't even crowded when we were there. I counted 7 or 8 other tables that were seated, that was about it. When you've got a big party and you know you're getting a mandatory tip, that shouldn't be grounds to just ignore the group and collect your cash at the end of the night. If there had been a manager going around asking how patrons were doing, we might have been able to point out our problem to him. But there wasn't. Guess bad service starts at the top and works its way down.

To be fair, the food itself was delicious, which is why I'm still not giving it 1 star. Everyone was happy with how everything came out and all the meat was cooked perfectly. The flavors here are fabulous.  It's a great spot for some yummy food, but I'd suggest never going in large parties or during regularly priced hours.

Best place in town for a craft cocktail. The staff is very professional and know their stuff. I really enjoyed flipping through their menu and picking different cocktails from different eras. The food is really good as well! Its pricy but it's worth every penny. You get your full worth for sure!!!!

It's really dark inside, no kidding. Really not enough light to even read the menus. Service was great and quick. Food (steak) was awesome!!! 4 pages just for drinks and 2 pages for the food. It was so tempting to try a cocktail but probably next time. Love this place.

This is by far my favorite place to eat in Vegas, I love the food, the atmosphere, the staff and the drinks. This is one place you can't go wrong. I feel like I've had everything off the menu from the Mac and cheese to the steak. Some of my favorites are the Mediterranean flat bread, seared salmon, mashed potatoes, flat iron steak, truffle fries, basically everything is amazing! The blinker is my go to drink-it's has blantons whiskey, grapefruit and raspberry flavor, shaken and served up! So good!

My first time here was last night for a Valentine's Day dinner with my dude, and it was amazing :) The staff was great, very attentive. Our server was very knowledgable in the realm of cocktails and had excellent suggestions! The meal was mouth watering, rich, and damn delicious! The NY Strip was so juicy and just the right amount of rare paired with some asparagus and the truffle mac and cheese, done and done! We will absolutely be back, thank you for making our even that much more enjoyable :)

We made a reservation via internet, but got no response back. We decided to go, anyway.... Difficult to find a parking spot (it's Happy Hour till 8 pm). Went inside, nice pub. 
Our server was Mike, very friendly.
We started with the carpaccio (17 dollar), great stuff !
Difficult to find the 'perfect' cocktail, but we had the 'bees knees' (11 dollar) and the WE at Waldorf (11 dollar). Very good !
My husband decided to order the Ribeye  (29.50 dollar) and I ordered the Flat Iron (17 dollar) ; both prices due to the HH time.

The meat was S U P E R... the taste.... mmmm unbelievable !

Latte & cappuccino was 4 dollar each and very good too.

Loved the place, we will come back in the future.

I love Herb & Rye. I like the dark decor and last time i was there on a friday night they had a DJ in there as well.  Aviation is my favorite drink there and i don't normally leave the bar without at least three of them ;)

The food is also great there, i like the wings (hot & sweet & crispy, YUM), beef carpaccio, mussels, and the steak actually tastes good here.  Definitely order it during their happy hours, really worth it :)

We had such a great meal, drinks, experience tonight. We were looking for a good local place and are so happy this is where we ended up. Great service and a fantastic night. Drinks were amazing. Food was outstanding (get the meatballs!). Thanks for making our Vegas adventure awesome. We will be back and will recommend you to all our friends.

First time here, was enticed to because of their happy hour, I mean $20 steaks are worth a try. The ambiance was pretty cool and the energy was upbeat despite the gloominess of the lighting, definitely great for a romantic date! The sides were awesome, I was a bit disappointed with my steak though, it was a bit chewy and not enough flavor, I should've gotten the rib eye instead! Word of advice though save room for dessert! The doughnuts were the star of the show! The waiter said that the desserts change daily so I hope ur lucky enough to have this on the menu that day!

It was a great choice for a date night with my husband. They have all these amazing cocktails from different eras & they definitely pride themselves on them as they should. I had a sprite, but my husband enjoyed the cocktail he had tremendously. He raved about it even after we left. The steaks were awesome & we had the asparagus & macaroni & cheese. Unfortunately, or asparagus was undercooked, but the rest of the meal was fantastic. The music was up too loud & didn't match the vibe or mood of the place. It has a very mob feel to it... Like a speakeasy..... The music..... Not at all.

Anther reason it lost a star is because our waiter was not a very good listener. When he first came around to take our drink orders, I was ready, but my husband wasn't.
